reviews.review:
CRABALICIOOOOOOOOOOUS! That's what you come in here for. I came  here on the AYCE snow crab deal for $19.99. I've had my crab cravings in the past, and I'd call around the buffets in vegas (Bacchanal, wicked spoon) to ask if they specifically serve snow crabs. Why pay $40-$50 when all i want to do is get my mulah's deal worth on some crab action.

4pm-10p.m. only on Fridays. I came here around 5:00p.m., thinking that there'd be a line, but no, it was a shoe-in. Service was quick, waters were constantly filled, and the crabbies were loaded on my plate. You get two sides included (which isn't AYCE). I highly recommend the SWEET POTATO WAFFLE FRIES. Probably the best I've ever had in my LYFE, SON! 

The french fries, mashed potatoes were average, and the fresh chips were really good. I just ate off of other people's plates, hence I got to try my medley of sides. 

I was stuffed by the end of the night. They also had some cookies that they sell Subway style by the cashier. I like my oatmeal cookies so it was yummy for my dessert. 

I'll definitely be back to fill my snow crab cravings!

Steak and eggs are $5.99! This starts at 12am till 6am! The steak was okay.. The service was pretty meh. Well they were pretty busy so I understood that part. Oh, and they got some good desserts too! The tiramisu, it's heaven!!! Try to eat here and you get what you pay for.

so this place has a special from 12 AM to 6AM they have have a $5.00 steak and egg , with toast!
Amazing deal right ?!
yes & no. The service here is terrible, slow, and unfriendly.  I literally had to flag down a waiter, then he gave me the wait finger,  finally took my order and didn't even put it in , 
he was straight up just rude. I know it's 1 AM but if it's part of your specialty have some integrity and don't make the place miserable
Food was really good.  It's just simple cooking with a low price tag.  Service was average. Serving size is average to large, neither one of us were able to finish our meals
I will eat here every time i stay at the Tuscany just for the tomato and basil omelet. All of their food is awesome though. So is their service.
Our server Miriam is awesome and attentive.. Very affordable. Look into their specials.. It's all god for the price $..

I feel like their midnight and after steak and eggs deal price went up, but whatevers since it's still around $5 haha!  Every time in Vegas I NEED to eat here or somewhere that has steak and eggs because it almost feels like tradition.  If I didn't it'd be taboo or something and my weekend wouldn't receive a blessing haha jk I'm just being a dork.  The service is always good and my boyfriend says that he feels like the steaks are shrinking in size or getting thinner, but $5 food is $5 food and I'm not complaining!

How do you beat $4.99 steak and eggs?  

Went here after having $5.99 steak and eggs from Ellis Island Cafe the previous night.  Marilyn's Cafe is definitely brighter and nicer in ambiance.  However, the potatoes from Ellis was better; and the beer at Ellis was cheaper too!

Our server was friendly and food came out quickly.  Check out both places and decide for yourself.

Best steak and eggs around. Like everyone said. It's only $4.99 for the night owls (12am-5am). It really is a perfect place to eat. 

It tastes like heaven literally ... Literally after coming from a club it's the best place to enjoy delicious hot meal. 

They ask you how you want your steak and how you want your eggs. Yum!!! 

The waiters are so nice and so helpful.... It makes a really big difference when you're tired from being out and your feet hurts from the heels and you have someone so wonderful serving food and always has a smile from their faces.

We recently stayed at the Tuscany and this restaurant was inside the casino attached to the hotel, and  this place was recommended to us by a friend.

The fact they have breakfast 24 hrs/day earns them 3 stars right off the bat.  The fact that the breakfast was tasty and excellent gives them another star.

I tried their sausage Benedict with grits, it came with a biscuit and gravy and some hash browns.  Firstly, very large portion, you can't leave hungry.  I wasn't too big on the grits but the rest was so tasty I wish I had room for more.

And the coffee?  Well this is the USA....so it was excellent.  Rich, strong and tasty, what a treat from the Canadian brown water we are subjected to.  Maybe this is why I travel the US so frequently, I love the quality of food.

And the prices...unbelievable.  Starting at $3.99 for endless pancakes.

My meal with coffee came to $10.00.

Other bonuses...free wi-fi, nearby casino, nearby patio = heaven!

Will come back for sure!

If you are looking for the ultimate nums after the club or for a late night meal, this is THEEEE place to go! Steak and eggs for 3.99, kind staff, and minimal wait? What more need i say? I go here just for steak and eggs at least 3 times a month. I definitely recommend this place!

Originally came to the Casino, and stayed to have late dinner.  Pleasant surprise.  Now, I go for the food, majority of the time its early Saturday breakfast or Thursday late evening dinner.  This place is open 24 hours.  Ample food for the price. If you gamble, you can use your Tuscany Players Club card and use your points for payment.

There is absolutely nothing wrong with this place. Grease? Yes, lots of it, oozing out of every porous surface and slathered thick and frothy. I must have had four grilled cheese sandwiches over the course of the weekend, each time with mashed potatoes and gravy so I could dip each bite of that buttery-ass sandwich into the gravy. I also had the fish and chips, though ALSO with mashed potatoes and gravy, as well as green beans, which, God bless Marilyn's Cafe, had bits of bacon in it. And grease.

Service was snappy and friendly, even when the place was packed to the gills with geriatrics and hungry drunks. They made a minor error with a to go order but quickly resolved it.

Even if I don't stay at Tuscany again, I think I'd still consider eating every meal here.

$6 for steak and eggs, hashbrowns and English muffin!? Yes please. This is a great deal from 12am-5a, after the club! They had signs up that they would not split checks. I assume due to the deal. It was decent for what it is. I would recommend getting the steak rare. I usually eat my steaks medium rare, but you know with these random cafes. Also if you like your hashbrowns crispy, get well done and they cook it on both sides. Yummy.

Great little GEM off the strip. We stayed at the Tuscsny and decided to try this place out. Glad we did. Very nicely decorated with a Tuscany Italian theme, fantastic service and the food was excellent. I ordered the chicken cordon blu, which you don't see offered in many restaurants. The entree was prepared perfectly and the sides, brown rice and whole kernel corn came out hot and were delicious. Highly recommended.

Got into Vegas late and didn't want to drive far at 11 at night. They get 3 stars because the portions are huge for the price you pay. They lost two stars because the food just doesn't taste all that well. Come in at certain times for excellent deals. They charge 18% for groups of 8 or more even if half of them are kids.

We were staying at the Tuscany (got there in the afternoon) and had to eat somewhere before seeing a show that night. Big menu so you should find something you like. The food is just OK but decent value for Vegas. Not worth a special trip but if you're nearby you could do worse.

When you can finally get up from the blackjack table and slot machines....... Give this cafe a try. 

The staff is the most kind and helpful group you will ever meet. The manager that runs the place is the most fun loving and cheek kisser to boot.. I love how clean an organized the place is.   

OK on to the food I love snow crab legs, but since I move here I have only seen cold snow crab legs that got to be a sin (checking my bible lol) This place right here let me repeat this place right here.  Awwwwwwsome snow crab legs!!!! The legs are fresh, large and precracked.......... ALL YOU CAN EAT!  So give a try if you are a seafood lover like myself.

I'm a repeat customer, but it's been a while.  I was used to getting crab and having to tell the server NOT to bring more..but this time (Friday @7pm) it was more like "hey....hey......hey......hey.....hey......ok.......hey......hey" to get a drink, refill, crab, lemons, etc.   
so, be sure to try and sit closer to register, away from the big tables.
I wouldn't go for the chicken pot pie, but the $6 burger was amazing value for your money!

We were addicted!
A big group of us were in town a few weeks ago and stumbled upon Marilyn's Cafe, while searching for a yummy breakfast off the strip.  We had breakfast here 3 of the 4 mornings we were in town!  

Great prices, yummy food and awesome service (I wish I could remember our servers name from our final breakfast there bc she was the best)!  

Their chicken fried steak is amazingly good (it was my first time ever trying it and I was hooked after trying a bite my first morning).  

Great place and will definitely be visited time and time again when we're back in town!
They have a pancake special all-you-can-eat for just 3,99$ that is very good and the staff is very friendly!

Well, it is convenient if you gamble at the Casino, but then you also get the ciggy smoke as the restaurant shares the same space.

Staff was friendly.  

Food was :meh; - some items definitely tasted of the can or mix - disappointed in the crab cakes, but the sides were all good and the veggies were fresh.  Agree with some other reviewers here, the cole slaw is the best of the sides.  Breakfast another day was the French Toast plate, OK but I asked for all bacon and got bacon and sausages... and the coffee was nothing special.  Portion size was ample but not overwhelming, best value when using 1/2 off coupons.

Sooooooo yummy! Portions are huge, we still had leftovers enough for dinner. Mmmmmm slppp yum yum 

Waldorf Salad and Tuesday special 1/2lb ribs & 1/2lb chicken with two servings of fries 

Plussss complementary corn bread, so yummy too! 

Always drink lemon water before meal  helps with digestion.

Ughhhh food coma cuz food is so bomb

My tummy is happy and fully satisfied. I'll definitely be back.

Good food, the pancakes were to die for. Service was outstanding our waiter Jesse was on point!!!!

Eggs were just right...

All you can eat crab legs on Fridays for around $20 makes Marilyn's an unbeatable option.  The crab legs were cooked well, there was plenty of butter, and the waiter was prompt with our reorders.  Unbeatable deal!

For value, service, availability and delivery this place gets all the stars!  Open 24 hours at our hotel we dined at Marilyn's twice. Once was "room service" but it's actually just delivery.  We dined in as well and both times servers were kind polite and accommodating. Short order cook is awesome as well. Jason and Julian served us they were both attentive and friendly.  Bowl of oatmeal with Mille brown sugar and raisins is $3 basic breakfast $6.  Cannot be beat!

Okay, this is definitely a hard place to avoid. I went back after 2 weeks since the 'no service' experience and sad face review. This time I made sure to request to be seated in my top choices of servers' area (I know them by name since I go there a lot). What I conclude is that  one time was a fluke but if it was my first experience I would've never gone back.  Anyway, all is good after I make the precaution of where to sit. 

Food: as great as usual so here's a general list of things that I have ordered before.

Coffee: The most important thing during breakfast - awesome. I'm not sure where they get the beans but IMO, it's better than Einstein's Bagels selection and it's better then Egg Works. Not that the other 2 is bad, I just like this coffee more.

Steak and Egg breakfast special: One of the best choice you can ask for if you are a steak fan. Every time I have ordered it it's made to perfection of the medium rare. The steak is lightly seasons so some people may want to add more. I've never been a fan of hash brown but this place makes it good. You get a choice of pancakes or toast.

Marilyn Starter: No way a person can get it wrong. Generic breakfast of eggs, sausage, bacon and pancakes. Ordered it a few times but only once that they over did the salt.

Grits - just right consistency. Great with butter and adding a bit of salt. 

Country Fried Steak: First time having CFS. Steak was moist and the batter was good. Would recommend.

Quiche: I had one with ham, pepper and onions and it came with a fruit cup. Probably the only thing I have ever gotten that I didn't really like. I was not a fan of the crust.

Sweet Potato Waffle Fries: A-mazing! Partial bias because by default I love anything with sweet potato. Still awesome to try.

Biscuits and gravy: Was a bit cold when I got the plate. Gravy is not bad but I think it would be better if it had some bits of sausages in there or just something else to add on the mushy texture.

Country Sausage Lovers Bowl: Aside from food coma in the middle of eating i. it's really good. Heaviest meal I've ever gotten from here. For $9 it fed me for 2 meals. 

Grilled Chicken & Eggs: Usually a gamble when it comes to chicken but the chef had chicken breast moist and tender and lightly seasoned.

Overall: Just give this place a try, you can't go wrong.
We were a group of 12 and sat us right away ... Awesome service , great food ..great prices...deff would come back ...

My husband and I ate here over the weekend and had the prime rib dinner and it was delicious.  The food came very quickly and the service was very good.  I ordered a side salad expecting it to be tiny and it was actually large enough for both of us to share .  If you are looking for a good meal at a great price check out Marilyn's Cafe.

There's only reason I come here. STEGGS! I love my steak well done with over medium eggs and extra crispy hash browns with a side of wheat toast. Can't imagine a better end to a long night. Their midnight steak and egg special is just SIX DOLLARS. Like really where else can you get steak and eggs for $6? 

Of all the Steggs places in Vegas, this is the only one that you don't have to be 21 to eat at yay! They don't do spilt checks though so bring cash or hope that someone you're eating with got money in the bank that you can pay back later for picking up the tab.

8:20am on a Tuesday. Two greeters can't figure out where to seat a party of 4. While they have 50+ menu it wasn't offered. Long wait for table service, but good when it showed up. Square coffee cups; strange. Pricing is very reasonable.

Many years ago a friend of mine got a gig at the Tuscany as a Cher impersonator. She made me come and all I remember is the old people with walkers blocking my way and the place looked old and terrible. Since then that's how I knew Tuscany looks like. So with all the good reviews about Marilyn's Cafe I really pictured an old hole in the wall Cafe. 
I was in the area and starving so I thought let's try it here. 
The casino looks great. It's remodeled since I've been here and for a minute I thought I'm at the wrong place. 
Marilyn's Cafe is very nice. I didn't expect servers with ties. Anyways,  I ordered the T-bone dinner ($16.99) and added half a Caesar salad ($2.99). It was pretty good. The meat wasn't bad at all. 
I got tiramisu for dessert and it was excellent. 
Service was wonderful too. 
I'm gonna come back one Friday to try their all-you-can-eat crab legs special.
woohoo! late night steak and eggs!  4 stars just for that!  ever since the one at gold coast turned into a TGIFriday, i have been looking for a late night steak and eggs.  victory!

MMMM...that $5 steak. What a deal! We left EDC early for this deal, totally worth it! You have to ask for their steak special though since it isn't listed on their menu. I ordered medium rare steak and over easy eggs which comes with hash browns and toasts. YUUM!! So cheap and you get what you pay for! 
This place makes me happy because come on! nowadays, food is just overpriced and finding places that offer deals like this just makes me happy. The food is good and fulfilling; they give you more than what you pay for. Not to mention, the service is awesome too! KUDOS to the lady that served us that night! She was so nice! She made sure that we got what we ordered, went back a few times to check up on us and asked if we needed anything else. AWESOME deal and AMAZING staff? This place deserves 5 stars! Way to go, Marilyn's Cafe!! (:

$4 steak and eggs special during midnight graveyard hours. Its not on the menu but you can ask the waitress about it and they will tell you about it. NOT bad for the portion they give you, it comes with hash browns and toast as well. What a deal! I only go here for their steak and eggs specials after a long night of clubbing and partying. Inside of the Tuscany suite at Marilyn cafe.

THE GOOD: They serve alcohol, they're open 24/7 and have all your diner needs. The prices are an ode to old school Vegas back when awesome food specials would draw you into random hotels. Perfect for after the club "sober me up" delectables.

THE BAD: The wait!!!  Oh my goodness!  You'd better have plenty of time to spare cause you'll have 3 major waits to deal with. First off its not on the strip, Second you'll wait a while to be seated and finally you'll wait a longer while to actually get your food.  I believe the long waits puts an unnecessary additional amount of pressure on the taste of the food.  We wanted Steak and Eggs and Yelped this place specifically for that reason.  Sadly the steak was REALLY tough and the hash browns were bland and uneventful. 

ALL IN ALL: Gets the job done but not at all memorable! Again it was probably the long wait that hurt the taste so I gave this place an additional star. With all that said I'd definitely go back at some random hour with less expectations.

A great place for early morning steak and eggs. $4.99 from 1am to 5am, $8.99 till 11am. Servers were fast and efficient, but very busy most of the time so you'd need to catch their attention. Cafe's furnishings are dated but in the middle of the night, you'd wouldn't really care. Menu is huge, i've yet to try anything else. Came here twice in a week to have their steak and eggs. Well cooked steak (medium), sunny side up eggs with potato hash. Will be trying the all-you-can-eat crab legs for $19 tonight. (only on Fridays for dinner).

Great place!  I found this gem on my Las Vegas trip.  I needed a place that gave me a specific Vegan diet and that is exactly what I received!  The staff was so friendly and the conservation was something I will surely cherish.  Thank you so much for running to the store for me and thank you for the free coffee!   

There was one con...no beans...but it was made up for!!!

I was leaving Las Vegas for an early morning flight to Chicago.  I had selected Marilyn's Café before the start of my trip and was glad I did. They are located within the Tuscany Hotel and Casino on Flamingo Ave off the Strip.  When I arrived at 4 30 am, it was very empty.  Table seating was instant and so was the table service.  I had ordered the "Big Winner" and it called that because it is a big breakfast!  2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, ham steak, toast or grits AND 2 pancakes!  Just what I needed because we all know the airlines don't serve food anymore.  The price was very reasonable for the amount of food and it was NOT a late night special.  It is on their regular menu.

You can't beat the $3.99 steak and eggs after midnight, but I like going in the morning M-F btw 6-11am for their $6.99 steak and eggs special with pancakes because the service during those times are awesome!  I can't remember her name, but our server was one the best servers I've ever had...and I'm not just saying that because she was cute.  The party in my table came one after another so we all ordered separately.  Our server didn't mind at all coming a multitude of times to take orders and run the food.  She was the best!  The other servers during that time slot rock also.  As for the food, surprisingly the cut of the steak isn't that bad.  I only had to slice off a bit of fat strip on the end, but after that the steak was pretty good.  On the down side, this cafe doesn't have A1 steak sauce.  They have Lea & Perrins which is sweeter, kinda ketchupie, but it isn't A1.  Pancakes were delicious and plentiful.  So plentiful I shared half my stack with my little niece.  Can't wait to come back in Christmas time to take advantage of their $3.99 steak and eggs!
The best breakfast we had while visiting Las Vegas. The hash browns were AMAZING. The meat lovers breakfast was also AMAZING. We ate there twice in one week.

What's more better after the club than sleep or drink more (for you alchys, jk) ? EAT! haha! after the night of burning calories from dancing it got me hungry and my friends & I all decided to hit up Tuscany for steak & eggs!! WOW $4.99 for steak, eggs, hash browns, and toast that is such a great deal! It took awhile for the food to come out but oh well it was worth the wait! I was a bit bummed that my steak was more on the almost well done side than medium-well. All our steaks were not all correctly cooked to what we wanted but hey it was only $4.99 and it's late so maybe the cooks were tired too lol Definitely a spot to hit up for some late night grubbin!

The advertisement i seen will I was driving caught my attention "All you can  eat crab legs",.  I thought this was a buffet but no you sit down and they serve you the crab legs and refills.  They also have other food to order as well.  The crab legs that I kept getting seemed to be the claws. (why me when I seen others getting the legs) The claws were so hard to open I even spilled over the tealight trying to fight with the claw.
  I asked the waitress can she give me more legs because it is difficult for me to open these hard claws.  The waitress was gone for a while and servicing others because it was quit busy in there due to the all you can eat crab legs.  When she would return she was always nice to me but she said, one thing and that this is all they have.  I was so disappointed due to I seen alot of folks with the legs.  So i order some prime rib taquitos.  (not good to me) 

 There was this one lady who seemed as if she was a "busboy"  always coming around asking can she get you anything and she is so happy to serve and help you. She did that a few times.  I thought How cool was she. I should have asked her to get me the legs.  I DON'T EAT CLAWS. LOL

This place is a hidden gem!! I'm preggo and stuck in Vegas for 5 days working. This equals ZERO for me to do or look forward too. A couple days ago I started craving a Mouth watering grilled steak. I ordered one from my hotels room service.... I almost cried. Such a waste of $40. If you've been or are pregnant, you know that craving will NOT go away until that spot is hit perfectly. tonight I decided to walk next door and give their cafe a go after hearing the food was decent. To my surprise- it was amazingly more then I would have ever expected for $14. Perfectly cooked meal, extremely friendly staff (thank you Rueben!) and desert decedent enough for the most lavish bakeries.  
  All in all. I highly recommend if in the area. More then worth the price and great staff. I'll be back for sure.
Their food is good and affordable plus have variety service is kinda slow and not highly motivated but it's good

The chicken Caesar wrap is great. The prices are pretty fair. The service was good. The prime rib sandwich was good. The salad was a good price and the good side. It's nice it's right to the casino. This is my second time here and I'm sure I'll be back.
This place has good food but bad service thats all
Great service and delicious food. I had the French toast with banana strawberry and blueberries. 5,50$. Great value.

$5 steak and eggs!!

Definitely a must after clubbing! My friends and I ALWAYS come here after a long night at the club because it's such a great deal for a good amount of food! 

The steak sometimes isn't how you order it but the hashbrowns and eggs always hit the spot! it also comes with toast. for $5 you can't go wrong! it's never really that crowded that late at night but it does kind of suck trying to find a taxi after you eat. 

I've actually been here not at 2am and the food is pretty good! definitely worth trying if you don't mind going a couple blocks off the strip. 

Note: the $5 steak and eggs deal is only available late at night.

Okay so for their $5 steak and egg deal from midnight until 5am, it's almost hard to beat. But to be quite honest I don't think I could come back as the place oozes sketchy people and slow service. 

Steak was tasty, eggs made to order, comes with plenty of toast and hash browns all for $5... My mouth is totally drooling but my heart is telling me no. If you can hold your own after the club then by all means, go because the food is awesome for what it costs! I however wouldn't come back. Hope this helps (and makes sense!!!!)

Not too bad.

Everyone else's food was ok.  No on really complained EXCEPT for my friend who ordered the OMELET with Jalapeos, Bell peppers and sausage...... but ONLY got Jalapeos, Bell peppers and sausage (with the egg) but NO CHEESE.... he was a little butt hurt....

Our server Jennifer was really nice.

I had the waffles and they were FANTASTIC.  The PATTY sausages are pretty good too.

I went to Tuscany on Flamingo Rd the restaurant there Marilyn's served us cold food. Under my steak was a short black hair. Right away less than 10 mins after getting our food I told the front cashier since our server was no where in sight after waiting 10 mins more she came to our table. I showed her the hair and she did not apologize but asked if I wanted something else (obviously I said no) and she walked away. Me and my friend sat there for 15 mins and decided to just leave. We walked outside and security came after us. I explained what happen and they said I had to speak with the manager. When we asked if the manager could come outside so it wouldn't cause us an embarrassing scene they threaten to call the police repeatedly. We went back inside. The manager was not waiting for us. It was the waitress with our check telling me that we walked out on our bill and I put my own hair into my food.  I told her my plate was barely touched. My hair is very long and black and my friends hair is very curly long and brown. The hair is pretty short, it was found under my steak and it had the root on it. This is why I was sure it was not my own hair. After accusing me the waitress walked away and I had to ASK a manager be called. I ASKED the cashier to call the police since my food was tampered with but he stated they could not call the police we would have to (after we were threaten several times that they would call on us). The manager arrived and wasn't told that a hair was in my food or that I notified two people before we left. He had to go find the waitress and confirm that information. He returned and told me no one in the back has long hair. At that point I asked him to look at the plate with the hair on it. He immediately looked at the hair and the food that was completely untouched and apologized and told us the bill is covered. We demanded security stop following us. It was a horrible experience. The customer service was terrible. If they sent security after us then a manager should have been notified, if a guest complains a hair is in the food a manager should be notified. I should not have been left at a table for 15 mins with no indication that the waitress would return nor resolution. It is poor customer service. Disrespectful to patrons. I will NEVER go to this place again. I will let everyone I know travelling to Vegas this year not to go here.

I was craving a big breakfast and I was not disappointed!!!  The prices are very reasonable and the portions are ample...  I was staying at the Palazzo and had to take a $10 taxi each way for this breakfast and it was better and cheaper than any breakfast I had all week at the Palazzo!

We were looking for a place off the strip to eat breakfast when I came across reviews for this place. It is located inside the Tuscany Hotel and Casino. There was a wait as apparently this place is pretty popular but it was do-able. 

Services was ok, it did seem somewhat lacking but not horrible. There were times when I waited quite some time for a refill on my coffee. Also, I got my food before my mimosa arrived which was weird since it's a simple drink to make. 

Food was average but you really can't complain because the prices are very reasonable. We walked out spending $30 on two breakfasts, coffee, a soda and a mimosa. On the strip you'd pay more than this for the food alone. 

I would go back because it was ok food and service but the pricing can't be beat. You'll leave full without breaking the bank.

Came in for AYCE CRABLEGS only to find out they ran out of crab legs. I just don't know anyone could offer AYCE and run out of your deal? 

I think it's extremely inconvenient for any customer to wait in line for about 30 minutes only to find out that they stopped serving what you came in for. 

Although the manager did apologize for the inconvenience it was a let down. Still a great place to go well worth it.

Took a walk to this nice little restaurant. I was surprised at how nice and clean this place was. It was very nice. I got the omlete George with turkey and was surprised how delicious it was. My wife had Belgian waffle, aside from the pretty slow service breakfast was delicious.
it's all about the graveyard special.  $3.99 steak and eggs!!  The steak is actually alright and the service is good.  Drunk people everywhere would like it because it's cheap and its fast.

This was a fantastic find! The walk was totally worth it. It just goes to show that you sometimes pay a premium for places on the strip that isn't even worth it. Vegas city blocks are long, but this one is a few away from the strip. We came here for breakfast, and it was delicious and I believe correctly priced for food and the overall value. The staff was on point. While one hostess was helping a customer paying the bill at the register, another one saw us to get us seated at a table. They seem to work well together noticing when refills were needed for beverages. I like that my chicken and waffles were tenders. It's been slightly annoying for me as of late to have to pick apart the chicken from bones. I am pretty sure that if I come back to Vegas again I would definitely stop in here for another meal. My boyfriend actually went back again the next day for breakfast.

This cafe is tucked away inside the Tuscany Casino, and it's well worth the trip even if you're not staying there. The have breakfast, lunch and dinner specials every day including a steak and eggs breakfast special that you just have to try to know how delicious it is. I've been here many times after finding this place when staying at the hotel and everything I've ordered here is cooked to order and tasty. They're open 24 hrs and their pricing is very reasonable even when not ordering a special

I was recommended to this place for some cheap food by my friend. I think he comes here when he's drunk/hungover. I was too sober for this. Our entire table got the steak eggs for $5.99 at around 12am when we had just arrived in Vegas. My dining experience was pretty much ruined by weirdos and loud skanky girls.

Marilyn's Café is located inside the Tuscany Suites Hotel.  It is their go-to restaurant for the hotel.  Basic food and should be easy to get in and out.  It was not.  The service was sub-par.  The wait staff seemed overworked and overloaded by the large groups we had.  The management knew there was a huge event in the hotel but didn't seem to book more staff to cover the overload.  

The staff were nice but just couldn't keep up. Plus, the management decided mid-stream that he would not allow split checks.  So, when we had had a split check one day, the next we couldn't.  

The food was basic diner food.  Nothing special.  But then, you don't need fancy for every meal in Vegas.  If the service had been better, we would have eaten there more.  After one particularly tedious two hour breakfast, we were over it and ate elsewhere for the rest of our stay.

Perfect cure for a late night craving. Looked for a late night steak & eggs joint and found Marilyn's on Yelp. Got a double order of steak & eggs. Each steak was 6 oz, came with hashbrowns, choice of bread (I got sourdough), and eggs (I got egg whites).  The price is the best part of the meal. Single order is $3.99. The steak is definitely no Prime cut Ribeye but what do you expect? I ordered medium-rare. One of the steaks was right on but the second one was well-done. I think it got mixed up with my buddy's 2 steaks. So, the food was pretty good but the price is why I gave it 4 stars.

Didn't go on crab night. Had some of the best food our entire trip here. Dessert was the only thing a little on the basic/mediocre side. Prime rib was amazing and so was the liver & onions! Try their homemade potato chips! YUM

Unbelievably good. Had the best 10oz prime rib anywhere for $12.99 and it came with two sides and bread. Had a choice of about 15 sides. Chose the sweet potato waffle fries and green beans. Everything was fresh and well seasoned. Had a brewed iced tea and with tip paid $19. Heard the 4 piece fried chicken for $8.99 is excellent too but the menu said to allow extra 15 minutes because it's made to order. This is my new go to place.

$3.99 steak and eggs! AMAZING! This is definitely where you'll find us after clubbin in Vegas. Like many said, the service is poor and slow... but hey, you can have steak, eggs, hash browns and toast for $5 (that's including tip and tax) Nothing hits the spot in Vegas quite like steak and eggs at Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany!
Our server was Tara. Amazing service! So friendly and helpful to our party of ten. We all had steak and eggs, and so bomb dot com for the price of 5.99! Hosts were also friendly!

We decided on this place because they had 4 out of 5 stars! What we experienced was a 2 star restaurant at most. Very slow service with no one really in the restaurant. Food took a long time to come out, silverware had food stuck on them, soup & salad came out wrong. The only good part was the homemade potato chips were good.
The service is terrible and I didn't like their breakfast , coffee and their cleaning conditions. The restaurant is old and dated. They even don't deserve one star.

This is definitely the spot to go after a night of clubbing and walking the strip! 

$5 steak and eggs includes steak & two eggs (both cooked to your liking), hash browns, and four pieces of toast with butter and jelly. You really can't beat this meal for the price.

Service was kind of slow (or maybe we were all just starving ...), but expected since this place fills up with people getting back from the club. For the low price, I can wait.

The steak & eggs special isn't on the menu, so just ask for it. It runs from midnight - 5am.
A little better than you would expect for the cost. Breakfast 24/7. Think GOOD greasy spoon!!!

Das Café / Restaurant ist im Tuscany Hotel & Casino untergebracht, es hat 24 Stunden geöffnet. Es ist frei zugänglich, egal ob Hotelgast oder nicht. Hotelgäste haben jedoch den Vorteil das vorhandene WLAN kostenlos nutzen können und ebenfalls Coupons bei der Ankunft erhalten. Es gibt vom Frühstück bis Abendessen fast alles rund um die Uhr. Die Preise sind wirklich moderat und der Service ist auf Zack. Es ist immer wieder eine gute Gelegenheit mit 2 Personen für ca. 25 Dollar ein gutes Frühstück zu bekommen. Ein kleiner Wermutstropfen ist bei vollem Gastraum die Lautstärke.

Food is so goooooddddd. I went here 3 times on my trip to Vegas. I had the chicken and waffles, french toast breakfast meal and chicken Alfredo. All three meals were so good. Can't wait to go back to Vegas just so I can eat here.
Great food, drinks and service. Best place we've had breakfast while staying in Vegas. We will definitely be back again.

Pretty good and super cheap! I had a breakfast that consisted of eggs bacon sausage pancakes toast ham and it only cost $9. They have steak n eggs for $5 as a special. Off the strip with easy parking.

Came here for the steak and eggs like everyone else. I was kind of disappointed. From the pictures that I had seen of the meal, it looked WAY better in pictures than in real life. The steak was really fatty and not very tasty, but hey it's a damn cheap meal and I'm fine with that after being out all night.

I have NEVER had such a good experience in a hotel/casino cafe before. The food here is off the hook! So good that we dined her twice a day our entire stay. My only complaint is that the staff could be a bit friendlier. Especially the night staff. 
Had the staff been friendlier, I would have given them 5 stars.

This place is by far one of my favorite places for daily late night happy hour specials on their food. They have a deal for endless pancakes for about $3 , a monster cheeseburger with fries for about $5 and my one and only regular order that I always get is the steak and eggs special for around $5. Other casinos that offer special cheap deals like this that I tried I was very disappointed overall with quality of the food and service and atmosphere but here at Marilyn's cafe you get great food made the way you ordered correctly. Very friendly and attentive servers and clean atmosphere.

Decent. 

Diner style restaurant but classier. Open late for your drunk munchies after you go h.a.m. in the club. Came here with some friends and opted for the breakfast choices. I mean the food doesn't look pretty, but its edible. The bread isn't entirely fresh in terms of home made. I am pretty sure they order like Wonder Bread and give us those slices.  I don't even remember how much everything costed..... Probably pricy because it's vegas? 

Whatevs.

Didn't fucking split checks and the waitress was a straight up bitch. Like wtf let us know what the fuckin policies are instead of lying and saying that you told us. Stupidest service, never coming here again wish I could give them half a star.

5.99 steak &eggs with a beer? COUNT ME IN! 

everytime i'm in vegas this is a must go to place! not only for one day but for every day that i'm in vegas &i do just that! the wait can vary depending on what time of the day you go but i come here around 11 am &the wait is about 10 min. ive only tried their steak &eggs but boy are they yummy! &did i mention the portion of the steak is huge &delicious?!?! the meal comes with steak, eggs, hash brown &bread and also your choice of beer all for only 5.99! can't beat that price anywhere &the service is also amazing as well we never had to ask for anything because our waitress always checked up on us &was very attentive! another added bonus is their hours! their open 24 hours a day so after the club this would be a perfect place to go too when you get hungry!
I stayed at the Tuscany hotel and this cafe/diner was really convenient with good quality food for affordable price.  Food was really nothing special, but just solid good quality.
Service is great as well as the food.  A great local spot.  Daily specials and breakfast specials are competitive with everyone else.

This review is only for the steak and eggs. Prices keep increasing every time I come (it was like $3.99 back then but now it's $5.99), but it is still the best late-night steak and eggs in town. Note, this pricing only applies after 1am or something super late like that, but hey, it's perfect for those after-clubbing munchies. I've never ordered anything else here.

My steak is always cooked perfectly medium rare. The one at Ellis Island is always overdone. I get my eggs sunny side up with runny yolk. Sourdough toast, which they spread melted butter all over. You don't even need the jam that they give you. And then hash browns to round it all out. Some places give you fried potatoes, which is just not the same. 

Located inside Tuscany Suites, which is only a few blocks away from the Strip. Open 24 hours, for obvious reasons. Never a wait. Seriously can't beat that!

Doesn't matter if you make the best food in the world, because if the service is lousy the restaurant is lousy. I chose to come here on my birthday yesterday I have all the restaurants and hotels in the world at Tuscany Suites. I'm sorry I ever came-due to the unprofessional inattentive servers,
 I got no service no one took my order after 15 minutes, and I had to attend a show which was a total farce. (Because the performers at the rat pack is back we're different than the ones that I thought I was getting you could sing on key.)

I asked what do you do for birthdays and they said oh we do nothing. Marilyn's doesn't have one dessert listed on their menu and I asked pacifically bring me something cake or something with a candle they couldn't even do that!
Finally, after having the most un-festive birthday I ever paid for in history, I went back to Marilyn's  at one of the morning and the manager on duty found a massive dessert platter and put a candle on it and she sang happy birthday to me.
 Why the hell couldnt they have done that when they were supposed to?
 Why was I told they don't do anything for birthdays, no cake,  no ice cream etc?

We stayed at the Platinum hotel so we just walked over to the Tuscany. We were seated immediately and our waiter Arnold was very attentive. He definitely gave us great customer service.

I ordered 2 pancakes (which btw was a very good price) with blueberries and strawberries on top! They were surprisingly better than IHOP! I was very pleased.

My boyfriend had also ordered the steak and egg. For $13 you get huge portions of steak, egg, hashbrowns, and toast. You get a good amount of food and quality for the price you pay.

The setting is very welcoming and home-y! Overall very happy we chose marilyns!

Ein sehr gutes Frühstück, alles frisch zubereitet und sehr freundliche Bedienung.
Das Preisleistungsverhältnis ist gut.

Yuck! The other reviewers were drunk when they wrote their reviews! I ordered the meat loaf with loaded hash browns and mac 'n cheese. Everything tasted mediocre at best and super processed. It all tasted like it had been heated in a bag. The meat loaf had no texture - it was shaped mush. The hash browns had zero crisp - mush. I haven't left that much food on my plate in a long time.
The food is great , ordered the chicken fried stake , I cleaned my plate ! it takes some time but it's worth it and the desert was amazing.

You can't beat $5 steak and eggs!  I came here with my dad and bf after a night out.  It was open at 3 AM (no surprise) and not very crowded at all.  We asked for the $5 steak and egg special.  It took about 15 minutes before we got our meal, and the steak was cooked just right and came with 2 eggs, hash browns, and toast.  Everything was delicious and nothing was left behind on the plate.  Best $5 I've ever spent!  The service was pretty good, and the restaurant definitely had a cafe atmosphere to it.  Even though it's a little out of the way from the Strip, I would definitely come here again!
Nothing like on the Strip. .. you get what you pay as always a rule of thumb. ... staff was not friendly,  was as a inconvenience to them to help. Food was not good quality.

Another one of Vegas' hidden gems. 

This one is off the Strip inside the Tuscany Suites and Casino on East Flamingo Rd. It's just located around the corner from Ellis Island Hotel & Casino, another gem of a place for good and bargain eats. 

Marilyn's Cafe is open for 24 hours and they have a daily special from 4PM - 10PM ranging in price from $7.99 to $18.99. Check out their menu here: http://www.tuscanylv.com/d/tuscany/media/PDF/marilyn_menu/marilynmenu.pdf

However...there's another special menu from midnight to 5AM. Yes, the special and staple that's ubiquitous of Vegas - The Steak & Eggs. 

How much? $4.99

That's more than a bargain; that's a Willie Mays steal of 2nd base without a throw from the Catcher kind of steal. You get an 8 oz. of juicy, delicious steak and eggs cooked to order. These steaks ain't the cheap kind they serve in Reno for the same price. It's a good-sized piece of steak that's tender, meaty and flavorful. Don't expect a cheap steak for a cheap price, but it was pretty decent quality for the right price. 

They also have an All-You-Can-Eat pancake for $3.99 for their midnight special. I'd have to say that's a lot of carbs for me, but it's there should you get the munchies. 

And I have to add that service was impeccable. I forgot our server's name, but he was a nice gentleman that was well seasoned. By that I mean experience and class. Servers from other fine-dining establishments could learn a thing or two from him. He made us feel at home, comfortable and relaxed. 

So the next time your in Vegas and hungry and starvin' like a broke-ass college student, don't run to the border or any closest fast food joint on every corner. Get some quality instead and your stomach and wallet will thank me for it.

*ONLY REVIEWING THE STEAK AND EGGS, VENUE, AND SERVICE

Very very impressed with the remodeling of Marilyn's Cafe! 

I only came here for the extremely inexpensive steak and eggs and they were significantly tastier and cheaper than The Steakhouse at Bill's. The steak was cooked well with larger portions compared to Bill's, hash was delicious, and the best part was that Marilyn's had A1 sauce (YESSS!!). A cheaper quality steak without A1 sauce is just not amazing to me. 

I truly believe that Marilyn's renovation did nothing but benefit them. The food quality has improved leaps and bounds and the dining area is spacious enough for late night dining and extremely clean. 

Also, I went here three times in the 9 days I was in Las Vegas during this past summer and I always had the same waiter. I wish I remembered his name because he was such a sweetheart. He was peppy at three in the morning and was extremely polite. He made the experience even better!

I am confident enough to brush off my prior statements of the Steak and Eggs at Bill's being better than Tuscany. Fellow Yelpers, Marilyn's Cafe for Steak and Eggs is the way to go! You wont regret it!
Good food and i love how the portions weren't disgustingly huge. It was just right for one person and some extra.

My husband had dinner here while I was exiled in NJ and he raved about it.  But he couldn't remember the name.  So when I checked on Yelp I figured it was Tuscany Gardens, which has some really good reviews. Big surprise when it turned out to be Marilyn's Cafe.  It's an effin' coffee shop!  No atmosphere, unless you like the "ambience" of a tired coffee shop.  And lots of people who can't talk in a normal tone of voice, along with shrieking children.  And a waiter (not ours) who goes to clear the vacated table next to us, finds no tip, and SLAMS the hard plastic drink card onto the table loud enough to make me jump out of my seat.

To further compound the misery, it was my birthday.  We weren't here to celebrate it, gawd no, but needed a quick bite to eat before an 8:00 pm Lionel Richie concert at PH, so we were captive.  

Having said all the negative stuff, I had a Reuben, and it was genuinely good.  I hate it when I order a grilled sandwich and it's floppy and ungrilled, but it actually was perfectly done.  The table had the usual condiments, but I like deli mustard on a deli sandwich.  When I asked if they had it, the waiter brought me a cup of a very drippy Dijon.  Not quite what I had in mind, but it was better than yellow mustard.  I can't remember what my husband ordered, but just as before, he liked it a lot.  

The service was pretty good, and if we're ever in the same circumstance, I might consider coming back.  The sandwich was that good.  But I'll bring my own mustard.
Great prices. They have 4$ all you can eat pancake. About 13$ for a big good breakfest. Free wifi

Went here for a well priced steak and it delivered. I got the prime rib and it was cooked to perfection. The server was very nice and the prices were good. The atmosphere is a typical cafe, nothing fancy. If you get a players card you can get a 10% off coupon. The only reason I didn't give more stars was the sides weren't great. The green beans were over cooked to my liking and the baked potato could have been cooked longer. But the meat was good and that was most important to me.

$5 Steak and eggs?! I'm in! This little gem is located in the read of the Tuscany Suites Hotel & Casino. There is free parking in the front lot as well. At midnight, this cafe has a special for $5: New York Steak, two eggs, 4 pieces of toast, and hash browns. If I lived in Vegas, I would definitely be coming back here more often because it's a quality meal for cheap!

The wife and I both had the $6.99 steak, eggs, pancake special that offer from 6am - 11am M-F.  Tasty all around.  We were glad we walked down from the Westin.  Christina, our server, was very nice and attentive--5 stars for her.  Everything was great, but the hash browns really stood out.  Would go back again without hesitation for a hearty breakfast!

Came back here this pass weekend and they were $3.99. 

I think because it was holiday weekend they up their price. But my steak and eggs were definitely on point! We went to the Victorian Room at Bills I think it was, right across from Ceasars and it made me regret not coming here instead.

So if you want some yummy decent Steak and Eggs for the price. Definitely come here!

Also don't complain about the steak, it's $3.99 people so don't expect a steak from Donavon's. Lower your standards.

I went with my niece & her friends, they wanted the all you can eat crab legs for 16 dollars. I like crab, but I don't LOVE it so I opted for the fried chickend, brocoli & mashed potatos. The mashed potatos were soooooooooooooo good! Everything else was ok. Now our waiter, Victor...was thee worst. I think he was having a bad day to begin with because when we got there he was having trouble with the previous table. Red flag #1 He was very quick with us, rude, impatient. I asked him if I could have the basket of bread that comes with my meal...he proceeded to tell me that I could not have it unless I requested it... Ummm sir that is why I am requesting it :) Some people at our table wanted to swap out their rice for something else because they didn't like it, he told us he was going to get in trouble with the chefs...etc.... And he also brought out an extra plate of crab legs and by the time they were ready to be eaten they were cold sooo unfortunately no one wanted them...he was really mad about that. I stayed as polite as I knew how to be before I went to management and let them know what was going on. I woould maybe go back to try something else, but I WILL NOT sit in Victors section #NOMAAM

$5.99 steak and eggs from 1am to 5am, though it doesn't seem to be advertised anywhere. We came as a party of five at around 1am and were seated immediately. Service was attentive. They were always checking up on us and refilling our waters.

Steak and eggs are cooked to your liking. You also get a choice of toast, as well as hash browns. Extremely filling! Fantastic portions for the price! I would actually recommend sharing if you aren't famished.

This place may be a bit hard to locate. It is in the 1pm direction of the casino. Definitely worth hitting up when you're in town! Also, no split checks allowed so have cash or venmo ready if you're coming in a big group!

This food was by far the worst ever. The powdered eggs look as bad as they look, soggy hash, undercooked pancakes and sour tuna melt were all just as bad. Management is rude and needs to step up on food quality.

Over an hour wait for breakfast from the time we ordered. The waitress acknowledged our wait time 45 minutes since the waitress waited to put our food order in our food ticket only showed we were waiting 25 minutes. I spoke with the manager and she said with our food ticket in hand we had only been waiting 25 minutes so I told her the waitress did not put I order in when we ordered. The only thing offered was would you like me to box up your food? Unacceptable !
Really great prices and good food. Prime rib is decent but the steak and eggs is the real deal. Pizzas pretty good too
Ate here everyday on our trip to Las Vegas. 5 days and I couldn't get enough! The prices are reasonable and food portions are big. Would recommend to anyone.

We tried this place because there was a coupon in the Entertainment Book. Since we like the mexican restaurant inside the Tuscany, we figured it was worth trying.

We had two sandwiches- we split it (our MO). It was very good, surprisingly, for a casino cafe. It's about $10 per person, without the Entertainment coupon. We've been here a couple times. The service is very good. The atmosphere is nice, and this restaurant is spacious inside. There are tables and chairs as well as booth seating available. 

It's truly "hit or miss" at these casino cafes. This is probably one of those little known/forgotten casinos and two of the restaurants here are really good.
Tasty, but random.  Do not order a chocolate shake it is kinda cold watery chocolate milk...  the pizza is good though.

Only been here once for their $3.99 steak and eggs after clubbing with my best friends. First thing, the server was nice and friendly (and also very pretty). She was taking three drunky people's orders and she was patient and didn't show any annoyance (at least not to our faces), since we were being loud and constantly laughing. Our orders came fast and for the price the serving was HUGE, almost couldn't fit three plates on a table that seats four. The steak wasn't dry and they didn't give us scrap meat either. I'm really impressed how delicious it was for only around $4.
Best prices and the quality is wondedul!  All the workers are so kind as well :) everything on the menu is phenomenal!!!!!!

Hash browns were not crispy.  Asked for it but they must've not heard me.  They were pretty soggy

NY steak is better at market at cafe.
Pancakes were pretty good

Inside casino but not smokey except for your short walk to get there.

Ate here twice, within the last month.  It's quickly becoming one of my favorite casino coffee shops.  On one visit, I had the NY steak and shrimp, and that was excellent and the price was very reasonable.  On my second visit, I had a reuben sandwich, and that was very very good. 
For a coffee shop, it's obvious that the staff takes pride in this cafe, and it even shows in the food presentation.  
I hope to be back soon!

I have always liked Marilyn's Cafe.  The atmosphere is quiet and secluded from the rest of the Casino (The Tuscany).  I have never had any major problems here and I don't foresee any in the future.  Breakfast anytime you want it... cheap eats... and good service, what else do you want?  Here is my review from my last visit:

 - We walk up to the counter and we were seated right away.

 - Our drink order was taken and brought out promptly.

 - The waitress came over and took our order.  

  * Side note: I am not one that is really picky but, I eat Ultra Low Carb throughout the week.  So, I ordered a burger with no bun and instead of fries, I asked for a side of bacon.  Of course my friends gave me a little grief - as good friends do from time to time.  Or, in my case, all of the time.  

Anyhow, she, said it she'll look into it.  It turned out to be no problem and I was charged the regular price.

 - We had ample time between our courses.  So, there was no rushing through the salad / soup because our main meal was on it's way out.

 - Our drinks were always full.

 - We were checked up on periodically.  

 - She gave us the desert pitch before handing us our bill.  

This is the type of service I want and expect when I choose to eat out.  So, with all of that said, it was a pretty good experience to just hang out with a couple of friends and have a pretty decent meal.

We had dinner here and it took 2 hours, making us almost late for our flight. A couple of things went wrong: one of our orders was messed up, the rare t-bone was medium well, and the service was extremely slow. It took us 10-15 min of waiting to get our check because after we asked for it our server went to take orders from another table, which took forever. It was an unpleasant experience because of all the things that went wrong. The food was decent but not enough to make us come back. All we got was a bunch of apologies and no improvement!

Decided to eat here before heading back to Long Beach based on the 4 star review on Yelp. 

I honestly can not figure out how this got an overall rating of 4 stars. My wife ordered a T-Bone breakfast and I ordered a New York Strip breakfast. 

We both ordered the steaks medium-well but my wife's steak came out rare and my was overcooked and tough as leather. 

The eggs, hash browns, and toast were average noting spectacular on par with a Denny's or Norms. 

The service was ok, it took awhile for us to receive our check. 

I really hate that my first review was a negative one, but I really don't want anyone to see the 4 star rating and think it's a great place because unfortunately it is just below average.

Disappointed! Pot roast dry, mac&cheese is out of a Kraft box, clam chowder tasteless. Service awful, server not rude, she took our order, brought our food, gave us our chk, & nothing more! & even though we sat near a main aisle, where she passed ever few mins, she never asked how things were & how we were doing, she didn't even refill our drinks. There's a flip menu on the table, saying u get a free dessert if a dessert tray isn't brought to u, I have never turned down a free offer, this time I did, I couldn't wait to leave. First & last visit ever.

STEAK & EGGS SPECIAL!!

**2016 Yelp 100 LV Challenge #4**

I purely come here for the Steak & Eggs, but time to time we get some biscuits & gravy as well. The place is very old cafe restaraunt style w/ all the condiments layer out on the tables. Every time we have been here.... the service has been pretty damn GOOD. Those who haven't gotten good service based on other reviews.... I don't really see it... or maybe we ALWAYS get lucky w/ an awesome server. On occasion our steaks don't come out the way we want it... but whatever... you get what you pay for. 

They have Steak & Egg special everyday after 12am 

STEAK & EGG SPECIAL $5.99 - for that price I think you get a pretty damn good meal... eggs however you like them.... a big slap of hash browns...  2 pieces of buttered toast, & what I believe may be around a 5oz. Steak that isn't too bad as long as it's not overcooked! 

I would come back all day any day I feel like have a cheap decent meal.... & honestly... wouldn't really care if I got bad service... you are getting McDonald's price for quality food! =]
First time at this casino, came to watch the Rat Pack show.  Tried this restaurant and food was amazing.  Best prime rib!!
Denver omelet was great. Top notch service, reasonable price for an in-casino restaurant, and good food.

We came in around 12:30 am for the steak and eggs special. It was okay. I mean it's definitely worth what you pay for. I really like their toasts. This is located in Tuscany Hotel. I think this is a good and cheap place to go to for a late night munch!
One of the best breakfasts ever!! Huge portions, really good eggs, homefriends, pancakes. BIG WIN!

I don't know how many times I ate here, like 100. For breakfast and when I was drunk, so it must have been too often. The food isn't too bad, but the price and it being open 24 hours is what makes this place so nice. I stayed at the hotel, so it was pretty convenient for me to eat here. The staff here is nice, even though I was probably a drunken fool.

Food was amazing!  Try the apple spread thing, whatever it was called.  Hashbrowns are usually bad at restaurants but this place knows what they're doing.  I would've never known about this place without Yelp.

steak & eggs!

steak and eggs for $3.99? i'm a fan. i think the deal is only valid between 2:00-5:00 am. definitely great after you've have a couple of drinks at a club dancing the night away. it does get crowded especially around 2:00 am. the deal is not on the menu, so you won't need it. just tell them how you want your steak and eggs and what kind of toast you would like. it also comes with hash browns! try the zucchini with ranch as an appetizer. it's worth it. will definitely come back again (it's a tradition)! check out the picture i posted.

Took about twenty minutes for a server to notice us and take our drink orders then it took another hour for our food to come out. I got the big winner. My scrambled eggs were orange. Talk about strange. My boyfriend thought it was Mac n cheese. The bacon was burnt and the sausage links were overcooked as well.. The pancakes and hash-browns were decent. I probably won't come back here for breakfast. My boyfriend got steak medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. Service sucks so bad and the food was decent.

$4.99 for steak, eggs, potatoes, break - say what!?  You can't ask for a better deal, especially after a long night of partying at 3 - 4 in the morning.

Don't expect quality steak at this price.  However, the food for sure hits the spot at the wee hours of the morning.

Our waiter was awesome, funny, attentive, and super friendly.

Love this place! Marilyns cafe has a little bit of everything on the menu. I myself prefer going Friday evenings for all you can eat crab legs for 16.95. Service is always fast and friendly. Aldo the assistant manager is such a sweet heart. He always makes sure that everyone is taken care of and is happy with the service and quality of food. 
I recommend this cafe

We had 2 breakfasts here during our stay at the hotel.  Very good both times.  I especially enjoyed the eggs benedict with perfectly cooked hash browns.  Thumbs up for the hollandaise sauce they serve.. good prices too.

$4 steak and eggs. Need I say more?

Actually, yes I should!  Marilyn's also offers a $5 burger (with french fries) that is pretty decent and in my opinion, actually better tasting than the aforementioned meal.

Three words: STEAK AND EGGS. 

Probably one of my favorite places to fulfill drunchies, or breakfast fill after a long night out in Vegas. From what I can remember, the prices are quite decent, if you're here before 4 am, I think you can get your steak and eggs for about 5 bucks? Don't count me on that quote, but for sure VERY CHEAP regardless. The place is located in the Tuscany Suites & Casino, and seems to always be busy when I'm here. 

Menu has a lot of different options, but I come here for the steak and eggs deal for breakfast. With an affordable price, well cooked steaks, eggs and hash browns with toast on the side, definitely a great breakfast for anyone. 

They do have other breakfast options to fulfill your cravings, and great daily specials for affordable prices as well. You will definitely find something that suits you. I always enjoy my food when I come here. 

I will say that the wait for your food can be a little while, but I tend to not notice when I'm around really good company. Just keep that in mind if you're not the type to wait for a while when hungry! 

Will definitely be back again!

After a successful night of clubbing, we all had some late night munchies and took the cab to Tuscany for some steak & eggs! We came around 3am and the place was pretty empty. All 10 of us ordered the usual steak & eggs (steak, eggs, toast & hash browns). Along with 2 cups of coffee. I'm not sure how much each plate was but the end total for all of us was $62 - probably including gratuity & tax. Not too shabby :)

The waiter was friendly and took our order quickly as well as refilled coffee whenever needed without us having to asking.

Just ate dinner here after checking in at the hotel and receiving a 2 for 1 coupon.  I had the Chicken Fried Steak.  It came with two sides (I chose cauliflower and mashed potatoes with gravy) and a bread basket with real butter.  I must say, I thought the food was very good and the portions were large.

I got the club sandwich and cole slaw to go for another meal, since there's a refridgerator in the room to keep it cold.

My waitress was exceptional.  She was extremely pleasant, polite, and courteous.  One of the very best I've had the pleasure of being served by.  I wish I'd remembered her name so I could give her credit.

I don't have a single complaint.  I would have to recommend this diner for anyone looking for a good meal at a reasonable cost.

Tried out this little gem on a whim.  I was staying at the Ramada next door...and when I tried to get some food via room service, I was told they no longer carry food for room service.  Bummer.  The front desk attendant told me to try out the cafe next door, and that a lot of their clients like it there.  Five minutes later, I am ordering a meat lover's skillet type meal for dinner.  It was good.  If I am in this area again, I will try this place again.  They serve diner type food plus alcohol...so its a decent spot.

Keeping a quiet night here in Vegas so I decided to order room service for a quick dinner. Pleasantly surprised, Grilled Pork Chops ($10.99) - both 8 oz chops are well cooked and well seasoned. All entrees are served with two side items of your choice. I ordered steamed broccoli and apple sauce along with a side garden salad ($2.99) and a last minute impulse order of cornbread ($2.69) - which is hot, buttery, and sweet served with whipped salty butter.  Ps. All of their portions are huuuuuge.  If you are looking to grab a quick filling bite with immediate service, Marilyn's Cafe gets a thumb up in my book. 

* Room service hours run from 6am-10pm
* $10 minimum service fee
* 18% gratuity

This place was such a horrific experience that it inspired me to write a review and to actually join Yelp just to try to have some say in helping others know to stay away from this obvious 13th level of Dante's inferno.  This is where all the bad people who do really, really horrible things are forced to go after they die.  Trust me.  As a person with 26 years of management experience in all manner of retail and restaurant, I can tell you that this place is falling apart and has lost its bearings at ALL levels.  The food comes out cold and with the attitude of "I have been under a heat lamp for 7 hours, dear God please help me!"  I have been here once and already know that their mantra is "we can't do that, sorry we can't do that, sorry you can't do that No NO NO."  This is the complete opposite of customer service.  Want some specifics?  Okay:  Breakfast for Dinner?  Eggs cold and mixed with what appears to be Rico's Nacho Cheese from a 1985 General Cinema theatre.  Sausage out so long it has a hard outer shell like an armadillo.  Vanilla Milkshake that has all the right ingredients - milk, ice cream - but they aren't mixed up right, so you basically have 2 balls of ice cream floating in milk.  Nice try to deconstruct that dish my friends!  Pancakes were ok.  Hashbrowns were ok - ketchup can cover up all manner of sin.  My son ordered that awesome "milk float" and it took over an hour to finally get the thing.  He said, "Dad it doesn't taste good, but I am SO thirsty!" and promptly drank it.  I tried it.  Yep, ice cream in milk without being mixed.  We saw our waitress whenever she wasn't helping the other three hundred guests.  The drink guy understood a few words.  He made it with the water a couple of times.  Then we asked for separate checks and the waitress told us we could pay separately at the counter.  Then we were told they don't do that.  That would be ten times were couldn't do something.  The customer is always wrong at Marilyn's.  After a long discussion and working our way up the chain of command the manager, the wonderfully non-delightful Dana gave up arguing with us and told us flatly "we will not separate your checks, just pay."  I gotta tell you, I've never been arrested for a thing, but I really did want to just walk away without paying.  I wouldn't even use my card because I don't trust this place enough to give them any information.  And that is ok, because they will never be getting another penny from me.  The casino either.  Oh, and did I mention I have some pull, some blogs and some juice here in the Valley?  Yeah, word of mouth is gonna grip tight on this one.  I guarantee it.  Go at your peril dear friends.  Better yet, get better service and some decent breakfast food just up the Strip . . . at Denny's.

I'm here.. After a night of partying ... How many times have I been to this cafe ? I lost count! Seriously ! Amazing wait staff and food is to the point!
  If its an early morning: get the Steak and eggs! Never fails!  If its dinner time: I like the half BBQ chicken and ribs; get the green beans ! Has bacon in it! Didn't think they would add that flavor element did you!?   
  So if you are on the strip. Want some affordable food and great service!? Marilyn's Cafe it is!

We had good expectations about dining here, unfortunately it was terrible. We eat out twice a day at least 5 days a week.
Got the chicken cordon blue, it was average and the two sides were cold, and the portions poor. My companion ordered the pot roast, which was above average, both, the size and portion. It was tender and yet dry.
Our plates were delivered close to 40 minutes after we ordered and a bread basket close to finishing our meals.
The worst service in all Las Vegas area. Server was not interested in providing a good meal experience. Bad waiter.
We are not coming here ever again!!

Came here again this past weekend for the steak and eggs and I noticed they now had $3.99 unlimited pancakes. So for $8 bucks you can get both and the pancakes are pretty good. Or you can split them like we did and just keep ordering more plates!

We went here on Thursday morning, Thanksgiving for family breakfast. 6 people so we are seated right at the front at a larger table.  Drinks served quickly, order taken in appropriate amount of time.  And then the wait started. We waited just under an hour for food to be served. I have no clue why so long as the place wasn't even full.

Food was alright, nothing exceptional or horrible. We had both breakfast and lunch items. Prices were acceptable. Servers friendly but the wait was painful.  Staff at casino on phone were rude when i asked where the restaurant was located. We won't go back.

I love that it's 24 hours, I come here every time that I'm in Vegas and staying at the Tuscany it's so convenient, the only thing I would say is to speed up the take out orders I waited for like 40mins at 1:30am for my food but other than that it was worth the wait. Oh yeah and there is plenty of food options and the price is amazing with good quality food.

First, it's a diner. Not to say that you shouldn't expect decent food but these places have a certain kind of menu and in my opinion, it was executed very well. Food was great and extremely inexpensive for Vegas, we're from Orange County and even at diners we're used to unnecessarily high restaurant prices so my boyfriend and I were both pretty surprised at how reasonable it was.

The service, however, is what the five stars is for.

James was our waiter and I'm pretty sure I've never had a sweeter, more helpful gentleman assist us. He was prompt, kind, and enthusiastic. He checked on us constantly even though the place was packed (at 1:30 am too!) and I know they were slammed that weekend since most of the city was booked out completely, including the Tuscany. We even called the manager over at to complement his service and she acknowledged that he always had a great attitude. I would come back for that alone!

Listen well: I come here with this expectation that any regular, run of the mill breakfast place--no matter where you go--..."breakfast food is always horrible when it's not gourmet". Some of you should write that down ;P 

But, not everyone can just sit down and afford $20 breakfasts at the top notch places. Some of us just want steak and eggs and don't want to spend a ton of money (me)! And some of us are drunk and hungry and need a 24/7 breakfast place (sometimes me)!!!

That being said, Marilyn's Cafe is not that bad. It's on par with IHOP and Blueberry Hill in terms of food. And let's face it--every cheap breakfast place you've stopped at is probably horrifyingly average.

AMBIANCE: 3 - The Cafe, or at least the inside seemed out of place. The Tuscany looks like a classy casino, until you step into the cafe, where it seems a bit worn down and old. However, it was very spacious inside and they try to sit everyone at booths since not a ton of people come visit them! 

SERVICE: 4 - Our waiter was really friendly and fast at servicing us. Our food came out quick--I know, how can it not?! It's steak and eggs!--and they left us alone for the most part except to refill drinks. 

FOOD: 3 - Word to the wise: Alert! Alert! BYOW. Bring Your Own Water. The water I had was nasty. I would strongly suggest some bottled water, or maybe you could get a soda! My steak and hash browns  were okay, as long as I had it with steak sauce! Don't get me wrong, the steak was big and juicy, there was just something off with the taste.  The eggs were good! I usually order either scrambled or over easy with cheese. 

Fun Facts: Their jelly that goes with their Toast is Heinz jelly instead of Smuckers! It's way, way better. 

Times were fun, MC. It's a win when you're on a budget! If I go again, I might just taste their pancakes because it's so cheap!

Steak & Eggs. Best thing to get after midnight and it's only $5.00! Steak was juicy, hash browns were good, toast was how it should be, and eggs were cooked exactly how I asked them to be. Service was alright and food took a while to get.

The service was kinda slow. 
But portion sides were huge!!

My coffee came out a little on the cold side. So make sure u ask for super hot coffee.

I'v been here twice and both times have been A-OK. lol This place has really good deals and the food is flavorful. I expected less from the food but it's actually flavorful. 
3 stars because they lack in the service department. I never ever ask to speak to a manager but the first time I was there I was waiting for a To-Go Box for like 20 minutes, I got up two times to ask for it again. The bus boy I asked was so unpleasant and ignored me, I felt the need to ask for a manager, the manager was not much better. He started making jokes and telling us stories about his personal life to steer us away from the bad experience? IDK? The service is just unprofessional. BUT the place is A-OK. Try it yourself!

Friends of mine have been here and said the food was really good so I thought i'd try it. Totally wished I didn't. I ordered the Frisco sandwich. It came looking shabby and thrown together. The worst part was the beef patty that tasted very gamey and not very fresh. I sent it back and ordered a basic two egg breakfast. The best part of that was the toast! Hash browns looked freezer burned, the eggs were runny and the bacon was cremated. There's no way i'll go back :(

4 stars for the menu variety, food quality and value
2 stars for the service
Don't eat here unless you have lots of time to kill
Server just disappeared on us....like 20 minutes
Other than that, she was nice, just ghostly
Once she came back, I had my credit card in hand, and have it to her.....she came back with the bill?  C'mon....I've got things to do!

5/5 stars for great customer service!

[SERVICE]
I came here around 4AM on a Friday night/Saturday morning with a group of 10 and we were seated immediately. The servers came by to take our drink orders and patiently took our food orders while we tried to figure out what everyone was getting. They also made sure to check on us throughout our meal. Thank you to the servers that were so kind and friendly, it was definitely the best service I've received in a while, and especially at such a weird dining hour.

[FOOD]
I ordered the NY strip steak with scrambled eggs, hash brown, and wheat toast. You can't get good steak and eggs at any time of the day for such a great price anywhere else! I ordered my steak medium well and it was cooked perfectly. Very satisfied with my order.

To summarize, the place is worth coming to for steak and eggs on your weekend Vegas trip.

Sometimes you want some greasy basic diner food. This is a great place for that. Perfectly crispy hashbrowns and scrambled eggs. You can also get one slice of French toast or one pancake on the cheap. Also breakfast served all day and it's open 24/7.

Came here for the late night/early morning special. I ordered the steak and eggs with a side of bacon & white rice. This was my first time here. I usually go to south point for steggs (steak & eggs) but a friend of mines recommend that I go here. Let me start off by saying that it looks nice and decent. 

Food 8/10- The steak and eggs came with hash browns and toast. The steak was a good portion for me. I have a small appetite. The white rice was really hard. Being Asian rice is everything and with that being said I was disappointed that the rice wasn't really "edible". Also, I noticed that my other two friends who also ordered rice had a different portion of it. One friend had a nice scoop of it nicely on a plate, while I had mines scattered and half the size of his portion. My other friend had only more than half of my size of rice and it looked like the rice was old and leftover. They tried to trick us is into thinking all the rice was the same by not arranging it into a scoop like my one friend. 

Service 6/10- We came here after an event. I felt like everyone kept giving us weird looks because we were "kids". The only guy that was nice and friendly was the one who served us our drinks. Our lady server was ok. I felt like she was annoyed and tried to rush everything. When we got our food, I asked if we could have soy sauce and she quickly left, which didn't get me the chance to ask for lemons.When she got back I asked if we could have lemons also & she asked in a very irritated voice "do you need anything else?!". I felt like she was only acting nice just to get good tip & wasn't genuinely nice or didn't really care about us at all. 
Overall, I'm not really sure if I would come back... Maybe....
Great Food and Service!! The menu is extensive and has something for everyone. The steak and eggs was amazing. We will be back for sure!!
Good food fast and great service. No kids menu but one order was great to split between the two kids. No wait to sit down.  Leaving happy.

Definately does not dissapoint. Its very affordable and not far from the strip. I came here for breakfast and ordered a Breakfast Burrito and my BF ordered a Regular breakfast. Staff was very friendly and everything was great. My hashbrowns were a little cold but they took care of it and were really nice about it. The food was really tasty. Great experience!

This review is about the AYCE Crab Dinner

Mediocre corn.
Mediocre rice.
Mediocre crab.

What happened? I use to love the AYCE crab dinner here because the crab was so warm and juicy.
