I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because our waitress was nice, but the management was horrible. 

I went for the all-you-can-eat crab on Friday with my coworkers and I'd have to say DON'T EVER GO WITH A GROUP FOR ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT CRABS. They don't split checks. There were 10 of us and the bill came to about $300. Once we went to the counter to pay, there was a sign that said they don't split checks. This sign was so hard to see considering how packed it was and people were almost always standing in front of it. 

We asked for the manager since we all had debit/credit cards to pay with. The manager first said that "the system" won't let them split checks on Fridays but any other day it will. We explained to him that were unable to pay unless it was separate. He, then, said he could split the check in two for us and told us to use the atm. This still was not going to work as none of us with credit cards were going to get a cash advance for this. He sighed and mumbled something under his breath with attitude and said he'll split the check in three for us. Since we still couldn't do this the waitress stepped in and said she would void the check and then separate it. The manager told her that the voided check would still come out of her taxes and she said it was ok. So this manager said fine and stormed off. 

We were there for about an hour just to pay for our check. I can't believe this place is getting business with such horrible management but I know I'm not going back again.

I can only imagine that most of the 4-5 star reviews here were written by drunken-late-night vacationers staying at the Tuscany.  We had a poorly prepared breakfast with weak coffee and limited service - cannot recommend.
If you stay at Tuscany Suites in Vegas, you can get 50% off coupon. Not fancy but good enough. The taste of grilled tilapia and prime rib were OK.

$3.99 steak and eggs after midnight!
that's pretty much all you need to know about this place. It comes with hash browns, and toast. The quality of the steak is so-so. I went here twice the last time I went to Vegas. The first night I ordered my steak "medium-well" and it was too red and bloody. The second night I ordered it "well-done" and it was still red. It wasn't that big of a deal for me because I'd still eat it but it might irk some people. The hash browns were also a bit undercooked. I only eat the toast top of the hash browns. 
But again, for $3.99, you get what you paid for. 
Service is great though. They were friendly and peppy for midnight =) That's why I give them 4 stars.

Marilyns' cooks everything well like most Vegas coffee shops...Ate there three times last week.  My colleague claims and I quote "The best dry rye toast ever"....not sure where he regularly eats toast

Hoever, I ate a couple of omelettes and both excelled as did the hash browns and the toast.  They have great specials like all you can eat pancakes, steak and eggs for 4 bucks as well as dailys like chicken pot pie

Marilyns is a great find...open 24 hours

This was our spot when we stayed at the Tuscany during our multiple Vegas trips. Open all the time and the $4.99 steak and eggs was a steal! Who could say no? It is especially enticing after a night on the strip and rounds of booze ;) So yeah, it might not be top quality steak or anything but drunchies claims otherwise!

!!! $5.99 STEAK AND EGGS FROM 12 AM - 5 AM !!!

Next time you find yourself in Vegas and awake after midnight, be sure to pay Marilyn's a visit solely for this special! This is clearly a blessing to late night partiers and midnight snackers alike. It was so great to enjoy a hearty sit down breakfast at 4 am after not having time to eat a proper meal all day. It's slightly off the beaten path of the Strip, but not too far to be inconvenient.

The food itself was average at best, but it was so cheap that it didn't really matter to me. If you care about the quality, then maybe you're better off going elsewhere. My steak had a lot of gristle on it that I had to cut off. The other elements (eggs, hash browns, toast) are hard to mess up so those were fine. I think the quality is comparable to normal diner food. My friend ordered a basket of calamari and it was not good, but then why would you get calamari at a diner? 

Service was polite and quick given the hour. This is a great spot for late night comfort food, good and simple.

Food: 2.5, Service: 3, Environment: 4, Price: 5
Five stars for their $5.99 Steak and Eggs! Especially after midnight! Definitely cures your drunchies.

$5 steak and eggs starting at midnight!

we got into vegas a little after 10pm and before we went too far along into the night of drinks, gambling, and more drinks, we wanted to grab some food. there weren't too many places that were nearby and open late serving decent food, but going to Marilyn's at the Tuscany was a unanimous choice given their steak and eggs special that we ordered right as we got in (which as luck would have it, was right at midnight).

ice tea, medium-well steak, and eggs over-medium, and sourdough toast for $5 and i'm a happy man, ready to burn the midnight oil on our first evening in Sin City.

the service was quick, which i'd imagine is either because a february Vegas trip isn't as crazy and packed as one in the summer, and/or the fact we got there right at 12. the other times when i've decided to stop at Marilyn's at the Tuscany for steak and eggs have been when it was closer to 3am, after a long night out cruising the strip or checking out one of the clubs and the waits (for our parties of 10+) have always been closer to an hour.

satisfying meal for the price. plus you can hit the $5 blackjack tables at the casino when you're done.

-civilities.

I walked over here from The Westin because of the delicious photos I saw of the waffle sweet potato fries and the great prices. It also looked like the environment was a lot better than Ellis Island.

Once I arrive I have to wait 5+ minutes to be sat because the host is off somewhere else. Then I'm sat and NO ONE comes to greet me, ask if I want something to drink or anything for 10 minutes! Finally a server on his way to drop off a guest check at the last remaining occupied table in my section stops and asks if I have been helped. I told him no and he takes my order and brings me back a water using lots of 'here you are beautiful'. He was the only saving grace of my visit but that was short lived because I overheard him telling his last table that his shift was over. 

I order the four piece fried chicken and it is brought out in about 12 minutes by a lady. No one comes back to check on me the entire time I'm eating. When I'm done I ask the food runner who I can get my check from and he says he'll let my server know. I find that interesting because 'I' don't even know who my server is. The lady who dropped off my food but never introduced herself or spoke to me drops off the check and asks if I want a box. I say yes. It then takes a little bit to get the box. As I get up to leave to go to the cashier she then yells out "Thank you so much, have a nice day!" as if she just remembered she wants a tip for her non-service.

So then I get to the cashier and it's a whole new barrel of monkeys. I hand the cashier my debit card and she says she needs my id for credit cards. I tell her I didn't bring it in my little wristlet because I didn't want to gamble and just came over for lunch. I say it's debit and I'll put in my pin. She says they don't have the machine and that I would need my ID.  I only left $8.79 in my wristlet and my check is $9.74 and I tell her again I didn't bring my license cause I walked and wasn't planning on gambling and just brought my debit card. I ask for a manager. She goes away, comes back and says the manager is busy but that it's their policy to need ID even for a debit card cause they are going to run it as credit and that I can go use the casino ATM. I tell her there is no way I'm taking out cash at a casino ATM and that there should have been a notice prior to a guest sitting down and eating in the restaurant that I would need id to use my debit card as that is not common practice to need one at restaurants. The large sign by the cash register only says you need id and room key if you are going to make a room charge. Seeing as how I'm at Tuscany eating and staying at The Westin that didn't apply to me. She then walks over to a small notice in small writing on the other side of the other register that says for credit cards you need id. Again I tell her that I brought by DEBIT card, and that little sign won't be seen by anyone, AND it would be seen after the fact. After someone has already eaten. I told her I'm trying to pay but I'm not using using their ATM and I only have $8.74 in cash on me and if the manager is too busy to come speak with a guest (I even showed her the copy of my work id that I have a pic of on my iphone that shows I'm airline crew which has helped many times at hotel front desks when I've locked my room key in my room and I need them to reissue me another one) then thatbis not my problem. Finally, she goes back to wherever she went before, comes back and takes the cash I do have and says next time bring ID, and I tell her there won't be a next time.

Between the horrible service, then the cashier incident, I would not go back to that place. The food was fine, but nothing special. Not to mention the pieces of chicken were 25-50% smaller than any normal sized chicken pieces you would get at KFC or the grocery store.
Steak, 2 eggs, and toast 5.99. Waiting for the food as we speak, don't imagine it being bad for the price.

All you can eat snow crab legs for $20 on friday night from 4-10.  Awesome!  Service was fast, snow crab was hot and delicious, plates were refilled promptly.  One of the best meals i've had in Vegas for sure!  Don't get the mac and cheese as a side, though.  It was nasty.  Cauliflower was delicious.

3 words. STEAK & EGGS!!

Have a night of clubbing at XS this was the joint to go to with my group of friends. At 3am the place was not as packed, which was good and the food was delicious. 5-6 dollar steak and eggs, who can let that go?

The steak was nicely seasoned and huge!! I couldn't even finish my meal. Maybe because I was exhausted from the night, but this is the go to spot for a night on the strip.
I love this place, I always come for the healthy section in the menu and the food is always good and consistent, thank you, and have a nice day.
Had 6 oz Steak& eggs. Soooo good. Wheat toast, French toast were delicious as well. Servers are attentive & friendly. Hash browns eh not so delicious.

Went here recently after some bowling. Wasn't expecting much but i was wrong. I order the steak and eggs, I ordered the steak well done, eggs scrambled and it came with toast and hash browns. The steak was a little small but I guess that's what you get for the price. The steak was good all on it's own didn't even need steak sauce, the eggs and hash brown was also great because I noticed they didn't overdo the salt.

I am definitely coming back here again!

This place is an awesome breakfast spot. Mostly because the prices are unbeatable anywhere else near the strip and the quality of food is pretty good. Great low key spot to go to for a hearty breakfast after a night of partying or a great spot for medium size groups. family friendly environment.  All you can eat pancakes for like $4, perfect right? There's not much trills as far as décor or atmosphere. It is what it is. A good food spot for somebody that's hungry. Note: I only went here for breakfast so can't speak on lunch or dinner.

I chose this place to go to for breakfast because we had a large family and I was looking for great breakfast deals plus good pancakes. It was to my surprise that none of that really applied to this place. 
The customer service was ok and our server was funny to say the most but the food was just OK. Nothing really to call home and tell Mama about . I ordered pancakes for my son and they were just mediocre. I really wish that I had just gone to IHOP but the ones out there received such bad ratings that I was willing to try something new as I usually am. 
The bathroom was clean and the restaurant didn't smell completely like the casino so that was a plus in my book seeing as though I'm from LA and can not stand the smoking laws out there. 
I'm a foodie but I don't mess around when it comes to my food  I most likely will never go here again.

I came here twice during my two day stay in Vegas. Good prices for a lot of food with pretty good service. It's like a hidden gem! It wasn't crowded at all both times that I went, at 1:30 PM and 5 AM. 

First time I got the 12 oz steak with loaded hash browns and potato salad. Potato salad was ok, so were the hash browns. I devoured the steak, I wanted it cooked medium well and it came out just the way I wanted! You can also request bread rolls but they ran out so they gave us corn bread which was delicious. For $12.99 it was a pretty good deal. 

Service was pretty good, the server came by to check on us a few times, refilled our water, gave us extra napkins... 

I don't have anything bad to say about this place!

Marilyn's Cafe is located inside of the Tuscany Suites and Casino.  Just off the casino floor, it's a fairly open restaurant and is very convenient for those who happen to be inside Tuscany.  We came here for a cheap dinner before heading out to the strip.  I had the spaghetti with meatballs for a reasonable $7.  It's cheap and affordable and the portions are average sized, but reasonable.  My friends enjoyed their dishes as well and we all finished our meals and ended up with empty plates.  The service was pretty slow, and even slower when you realized that the cafe was not quite filled up at all.  However, we couldn't deny the deal we were getting.  

Pro Tip: Apparently there's a deal for $3 steak and eggs early in the morning (3 am to 7 am).
Service is excellent. Bread was over buttered. Nice little cafe with good prices. Food was overall good.
Service was fantastic. Our waitress Miriam was amazing, attentive, prompt and alert. The food was so damn delicious and so cheap. Like 3 blocks away from the strip behind the Linq.

This place is great for late night steak and eggs. Just make sure you're aware that they do not split checks in the later hours. Their steak and eggs are delicious and very inexpensive. If your waiter turns out to be James, you're gonna be in great hands because he's a great guy, very professional and genuine. Definitely recommend this restaurant if you want something late at night!

How has it taken me this long to discover this restaurant?!  The best Steak & Eggs the Strip has to offer!  & what is better is that it is only $5.99!

My girlfriends & I came here after Omnia around 3a after our other girlfriend recommended it & it had quite a few customers.  Great customer service! 

Steak & Eggs, served with Hasbrowns & Toast - I ordered it medium & it was juicy, tender, & flavorful!  What a hearty meal!

Came here for an early dinner at around 5 on a Monday.  Had the prime rib special...prime rib not flavorful at all, glazed carrots were not glazed, although you could taste the brown sugar.  Broccoli tasted old.  Decent prices though!

Awesome! Servers were friendly and helpful. Great size portions, my 3 sons didn't leave hungry. Great price near the strip. Food has good flavor, I thought the 3.99 all you could eat pancakes were a pleasant surprise.

My group of friends and I always come here after a night of clubbing in Vegas at like 4am.  We got seated quickly and the place isn't crowded at this time.

It's cheap, tasty, and filling. It's roughly $6 for eggs, steak, hash browns, and toast.  I think they only offer this price during a limited time of the day. So, be sure to check on that. 

Service is friendly and attentive.

Cheap breakfast place, it's inside to Tuscany so don't think it's a diner by itself. Self-parking is plentiful, great location since it's a very short drive from the other big hotels on the strip. 

Everything here is fantastic, I don't know how people had a bad experience. No problems with my breakfast combo, and my friends enjoyed their meal too. Pancakes are perfectly golden brown and fluffy, eggs made as ordered... bacon even made extra cripsy when requested. There is really is nothing to complain about: inexpensive pricing, service friendly and attentive with clean tables!

Just love places in Vegas that don't shaft you just because they can. Like when you go to a theme park and they say, fork you! we have you trapped pay $6 for this small bottle of water! Thank you Marilyn's Cafe, keeping this place in mind whenever I'm in this area of Vegas for breakfast.

You go here for one reason and one reason only.

$3.99 Steak & Eggs after midnight. They don't advertise it, you just gotta hear about it. It's like a secret club @ the Tuscany that all the Asians hit up after a night of hardcore partying. & boy, does it hit the spot. $3.99, what a freakin' steal! No wonder the asians flock here.

This diner-style restaurant is located inside the Tuscany, a casino where few younger party-folks venture out, and let me tell you... this place is freaking amazing as a 12-5am pit stop after the club for the $3.99 steak and eggs special. 

No, it is not the most gourmet quality steak you will ever eat, but it's a healthy-sized, juicy cut without tons of fat. The taste is decent, made delicious with lots of BBQ sauce. And when it comes to the drunchies when all you want is a satisfying meal for a low price, it's def a great value. Comes with two eggs cooked as you like, hashbrowns (and they're good!!) and with toast of a bread of your choice - makes for a HUGE meal for the price. 

Haven't tried anything else, but that deal alone is worth the trip. And the time window is pretty big - 12am is early in Vegas time!! If steak/eggs isn't your thing, they have plenty of other menu items and a couple other specials (I think  $5 monster burger?) but really, if you realllyy WANT something else, you're better off elsewhere!
You can't beat $4.99 steak and eggs cooked just as you would like it. Come right after you go out - no wait, quick and friendly service, and BUTTERY toast. Seriously... $4.99. Yesss!

This was my second time here and I was so disappointed. It literally took about 30 minute to take our drink order, another 20 minutes to receive it, another 20 minutes to take our orders (btw 8.99 steak & eggs is from 6a to 11a only!). They didn't even bring everything we ordered out until we pretty much had to beg for it.

Overall it was the worst service I have ever experienced in Vegas and the servers had no remorse but then again why should they. 2 stars because their food is good, I'll give you that but at what cost, you know?

Did you have a raging night and you're hungry?

Cheap steak and eggs! $5-ish plus tax, plus tip. Service is okay. Don't expect them to be on top of it. They're short handed and trying to be quick and efficient.

I seriously just come here for the steak and eggs. Don't ask me how the other food tastes like.

Best breakfast in Vegas!! I love breakfast and there are a million places to eat in Vegas so I looked on yelp for the best breakfast near the strip and this is what I found! It's inside the Tuscany Suites and Casino, straight back from the entrance of the casino. It's a 24 hour cafe that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would compare this to a mom and pop version of Denny's, with better prices. 

I got the "Big Winner" which comes with 2 eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, toast, hash browns AND pancakes..... for $8.99!!!! And this isn't even a special! They have cheaper prices if you come during certain times on weekdays. And the taste was GREAT. We really liked our server John. He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made our experience even better.

Basically..... I can't wait to come back to Vegas to have breakfast at Marilyn's!

My friends and I walked here from the strip and it took us about 20 minutes following the GPS on our phones. At 1AM in the morning, the walk felt pretty shady. But we made it safely!

After wandering into the Tuscany hotel and casino, we were directed to Marilyn's Cafe. As a group of 5, my friends and I were seated nearly immediately. Once our waiter came around to take our order, he automatically asked if all wanted the steak and eggs. Assumption correct!

At $5.99, the steak and eggs were such a steal! Steak and eggs were both cooked according to personal preferences and they even include toast plus hashbrowns.

Not sure if it was just the late night hunger talking or what, but the steak was delicious! Best $5.99 I spent in Vegas! I'd definitely recommend coming here!

My girls and I (Katie H. and Kelsey W.) just finished a night at Marquee and wanted some grub after all that dancing. They convinced me to come here for late night food and we got there at around 3:30am Sunday morning. 

Based on location and decor, I was not feeling this place. Only thing that saved my hesitation though was the fact that so many people were there at that foresaken hour!

We each got the famous steak and eggs (steak medium and eggs scrambled) and damnnnn was I in for a treat! Eggs done well, steak just the right portion size and texture, a ton of crispy hash browns, and toast slathered in butter beauty. OMG talk about satisfying! 

I didn't care about the decor, I didn't care that we went off the strip to get here, and I def didn't care that I was eating that much food in the middle of the night! AND ONLY $4.99?!!! So much beauty in one night.

Woooooo good work Marilyn's Cafe! You made a fan out of a disbeliever!

Marilyn's is a traditional American restaurant located in the Tuscany Suites and Casino ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/tuscany-hotel-and-casino-las-vegas#hrid:tHx9zD374l4yfy6zp3rLZw ) on Flamingo Street in Las Vegas. It was pretty late in the Evening last week, and we heard about the popularity of the $3.99 Steak & Eggs - there really aren't any more CHEAP Breakfasts around Las Vegas any more - this is one of the remnants from the good ol' days. The inexpensive Steak & Eggs, from what I understand, are especially popular with Students.

Marilyn's is named after one of the original owners of the Tuscany Casino... even though presently, the Tuscany is corporately owned. Decor is laid-back 50s, especially with the dim incandescent tube lamps over each table or booth. Reminded me of a Spanish Hacienda or an Italian Villa themed restaurant with the dark woods and dim lights.... in keeping, I guess, with the Tuscany theme of the Casino.

On the menu...

Prime Rib (**** $10.95) Meat! That's what I like! The only qualification of a good cut of Prime Rib, IMO, is... leave some Fat in my cut of Prime Rib! And that's what the Chefs at Marilyn's accomplish. Quite a bit more than the 10 ounces stated on the menu... that's alright by me! Side of Cauliflower (** 1/2) - way, way over-cooked, though. And a side of Baked Potato (*** 1/2)... pretty hard not to mess this up. Prefaced with some Dinner Rolls with Butter - OK. Also came with a tin of Au Jus - kids were asking why I wasn't dipping - I never mess up a piece of good meat with anything else!

At less than $1.00 per ounce of Beef - a very, very good value, especially with some Fat left on the Prime Rib. Lucky for me tonight, Marilyn's didn't try to get "Healthy" on me... Ate the Whole Thing! Nothing left on the plate!

Fried Bananas (****) The low rating for this Dessert was primarily my fault... took a little longer to finish the Prime Rib than I thought it would. Therefore the Fried Bananas just sat for a few minutes longer than it should have. I'm a meat guy... wanted to finish off that Beef before starting on the Sweet Stuff! Don't "mess" with the Fried Bananas with a side of Ice Cream... liked it the way if was... just Fried. Really, really good finish to the meal. 

Iced Tea

Value (**** 1/2) As with most restaurants in Casinos, the value factor in a restaurant is usually pretty high because the losses you incur at gambling usually will cover the expenses that most Casino restaurants incur. 

Not crowded on a late weekday evening, just three tables occupied when we dined here... BUT, as with any restaurant associated with a Casino or Hotel in Las Vegas... there WILL be lines and lines of people on the Weekends! This is a basic Casino Coffee Shop, if you don't equate Marilyn's to Fine Dining you'll be OK.

Place is pretty neat it's not all crowded as I was expecting due to the casino. The food was delicious will definitely be coming back here tomorrow :) Service was good lady and gentleman were pretty friendly.

What a joke! Service is way too long for 1:00am (not pm) and basically empty. Still it took more than 15 minutes to bring out breakfast food. I got up and left, disgusted! Overpriced...$8 for a breakfast bagel! You must be kidding. I will go to Starbucks instead and pay 1/'2 that for the same plus coffee.

service was pretty shitty here. besides "hair" as i liked to call him, the servers would consistently mess up our orders, give us corn (why??) instead of the actual veggie sides we'd order and didnt know about any drinks they make. anyway, the chicken fingers and taquitos are good for appetizers. the cajun shrimp pasta is fantastic. the fish they had was nasty and tasted dirty. but the breakfasts! deleecious!

I suggest ordering pizza - the handmade pizza's here are to die for!

The turkey ruben was a 4 star sandwich and I also tasted the patty melt which was pretty darn good also.

The servers are a bit slow, and the smoke from the casino is a bit bothersome but overall... good food great prices.

All the cool people know where to get good $5 steak & eggs... And that's at Marilyn's Cafe in the Tuscany hotel and casino off the strip!

A perfect place to grab some food after partying all night at the nightclub.

Hardly any wait to get seated. 
Service is quick and friendly. 
Good for big groups. 
They open late night.

$5 steak and eggs and it comes with hash browns and toast. Good deal! 

***FYI you cannot get the $5 deal if you order the meal for take-out!!! Or else you pay regular price 

***And another tip: It's difficult to get a taxi to pick you up at Tuscany, so I suggest using Uber or Lyft!

All you can eat crab!  It was good and plentiful. I was shocked at how good it was. Hot butter and plenty of lemon. Great service. I couldn't have eaten more. They are very generous with the crab. Some places give you a plate and forget you. Not here. Yes it's loud but that's a small price to pay!

What a HUGE menu, and this place is open 24 hours! Everything on the menu is a steal, the prices are so good. I've been here a couple of times, its no 5-star dining experience, but its the most bang for your buck around.

I was in a party of 4 and we seated at a very small table, we asked to be moved to a different table. Apparently our new table was in a different waiters zone, but out old waiter (who had not given us anything other than the menus) decided to keep serving us. Both waiters kept repeating the other by asking for our drink orders in succession, each unaware of the other. Once they found out there was a slight verbal disagreement as to who would actually serve us. Made for a bit of an awkward experience for us. Our original server, probably not used to serving this table, neglected us a lot, and we found ourselves asking the server for this area for assistance quite often. Our food took tremendously long, almost 30 minutes to come out, and this was at 1pm....

I would come back again for the menu, hopefully service will be better organized next time.
For their grave shift prices, they were good food. My cousin brought me here and she ordered for us. Just a little past midnight snack. Lol

This was my last meal before leaving the great city of Las Vegas. Some of the people in our group swore by it and I am so glad they made the recommendation. Like some of the other reviews, my only issue was the speed of service. But our waitress Patty was super cool and came back to check in on us pretty often.

Would love to experience this place after a long night out on the Strip, maybe next trip...

Thanks to Yelp, I found this 24 hour place in the middle of the night after a major party at the Cathouse.  We ended up going here twice a day during our four day trip.  

Good prices on some good food.  See my pics!  

The ribs were falling off the bone, WOW!  The Frisco burger was yummy juicy.  The steak n eggs were fresh and full filling.  AND the Lasagna was oozing over with deliciousness!!!!!

It was a great way to start off the day and end the night.  This place can be found in the Tuscany Suites less than 5 mins away from the strip.

$6 for two eggs any style, hash brown, 2 slices of toast, and steak prepared any way you like it? I'm in! This place is the place to go when you're in Vegas. I definitely recommend this place after a night of clubbing or drinking because this place is open 24/7 and it's super cheap! 

This restaurant has great service and is customer friendly! The restaurant is located in the Tuscany hotel and casino a little off the strip but I highly recommend it for those who like to eat late!

Me and my wife had the prime rib and turkey the prime rib was very Bland tough the turkey was what I over-salted dry the food I'm pretty sure food served at a homeless shelter would have tasted better than this it was overpriced and then I had to wait 15 minutes at the register while three attendance sat there and ignored me didn't say a single word to me with no one in front of me in the line I highly recommend that no one ever eats at this restaurant

$3.99 Steak & Eggs! The perfect meal when you've had a bit too manys drink after a night of dancing in Vegas. I am definitely coming here again!

Also, WATER! Our waiter was super good at refilling our water, especially after being so dehydrated from all the alcohol.

Best place for steak and eggs after a night of drinking! 

$4.95 for steak and eggs and $3.99 for AYCE pancakes, making it a great night owl place after hitting up the clubs or a night of drinking. 

The steak and eggs entree also comes with a side of toast and some hashbrowns. 

I've been here numerous times and I've always experienced good service even in the twilight hours of the night. 

They also have milkshakes which I recommend, both the chocolate and strawberry are delish!

I've been here about 3 times, but it seems that each time is less memorable than the previous visit.  It's a good deal for the crab, but in my opinion there are so many options in Vegas that surpass Marilyn's Cafe.

Pros:  
  *  There's an AYCE crab feast for $15.98 per person on Friday nights
  *  the AYCE option comes with 2 side dishes 
  *  Free refills on drinks 
  *  Service was pretty good.  The manager of the restaurant even came by.
  *  Quality of the crab itself was mediocre

Cons:
  *  Outdated ambiance
  *  No refills on your sides
  *  Slow service
  *  Raised the price on the AYCE option (previously $12.99)
  *  It was cold throughout the restaurant.

Overall:
  Since the last time I went here, it seems that they have boosted up the price a bit on the AYCE.  That was the main thing that Marilyn's Cafe had going for them was the crab at a killer price.  Since it's a bit more expensive now (in comparison to before), there are other places throughout the valley that offer AYCE for a little more money (way better quality though and more for your money too).  It also doesn't help that was extremely chilly inside the restaurant.  It made my meal less enjoyable.  I live in the Northwest side of town and it's always a pain to get to Tuscany Suites from home (especially on a Friday night).  I do not think I'll be coming here for their AYCE crab anytime soon.  Perhaps on another night for their regular menu, but I have yet to try that.  I'll definitely update my review once I do though.  From reading other reviews, it seems like they have some other good deals that are worth checking out (such as the Steak and Egss for $3.99... unless they changed the price on that too?)

Tips:
  *  Make sure to check out the menu for all the other days.  Different days = different specials
  *  Bring something warm to wear.  It was very cold in there.
  *  You have to walk out of the restaurant to use the restroom, but its right around the corner.

We had some phenomenal service on a busy Saturday morning!  Nedra, our waitress, was awesome.  (pretty, too!) She was attentive, always nearby and had some great suggestions.  She actually seemed to be happy to do her job, not like some of the soulless eyes that stare back at you in Vegas.  

Jeff got the eggs benedict.  He had ordered them the day before and decided to do them again.  They looked great and the eggs were perfectly cooked.  He got some orange juice.  It was ok, but it had a flavor that we couldn't quite place.  I think there may have been something else in the juice mix, maybe tangerine.  

I got the chili omelet with grits.  The grits were delicious, not too dry and not undercooked.  They added a dollop of butter, which is the way that everyone should eat grits.  (Now, if they had some cheese, I might have added a little of that, too.  I guess I could have asked, but a chili omelet is already enough gut-busting damage as it is.)  The chili was kinda funky and didn't have much flavor.  The omelet was well done, however.  It wasn't too dry nor too runny.  I wasn't going to order toast, but then I changed my mind.  Nedra had toast out to me in less than a minute and it was hot and buttered.  Damn, that is good service.

Jeff got excited and accidentally knocked over his juice, all over the toast.  Within 3 milliseconds, there was a waiter/busboy with a stack of napkins to wipe up the spill.  He was gone and back in a flash with more napkins.  Nedra came over, tsk'd us, offered more juice and brought out more toast.  So impressive. Most places would just ignore you.  
The style of the restaurant reminded me of broken-down Santa Fe style, though I'm sure they were trying to imitate some rustic Italian villa.  (It doesn't work.)

Normally, I would give this place a 3 star, but Nedra made it 4.

I used to come here more often years ago when they had a promotion where you would get $10 off on any bill of $20 or over.Almost everybody that I recommended this place to or dined with liked it.My friend Arthur is visiting Las Vegas and he is staying at the Tuscany so I suggested that we have lunch here.We both had prime rib and we both enjoyed it immensely.
The price is very reasonable and the quality of the food is quite good.You're not getting overcharged like you would be in a lot of the tourist traps in the Strip,where you're paying for a brand name.Our food server Wendy was an absolute sweetheart.She was very warm,friendly,personable and efficient.They have a large selection of side dishes,too,of which you get your choice of two included with any entree.I cannot recommend this place enough.You will get very good value for your dollar and the quality of your food should be to your liking,IMHO.

The best prime rib deal in Las Vegas.  Prime Rib 10oz with two sides for $14.  If your Filipino like me, they have white rice as a side.  Yes, a medium rare prime rib with white rice, au jus and horseradishes is a Filipinos dream.

Steak and eggs is a staple of drunk or "been drinking a bit so now I'm really hungry" food in Las Vegas. 

While there are a few choices in Vegas I always choose Marilyn's Cafe at the Tuscany because its 1. close by to the strip 2. its not crowded, no wait in line 3. it taste OK.

Your steak and eggs is $4.99 from something like 11pm - 5am, consist of a 6ish oz steak, two eggs, hash browns, and toast. Pretty basic, but a core essential in waking up without a hangover. 

I've had the other food before on their extensive menu and it gets a pass.

If you do come here for steak and eggs they no longer allow bill splitting during steak and eggs time so bring CASH.

Great alternative to waiting in a long line at Ellis Island for almost the same exact $5.99 steak and eggs deal! 

I found the steak to be much better here because it has a less burnt taste compared to Ellis Island. The only thing I didn't really like were the hashbrowns.
Good food for a casino breakfast. Good service and fairly cheap. Easy seating quick service, in and out

Ask for James! For sure he works Friday and Saturday late nights. He makes four AM seems like any time of the day and has GREAT local suggestions!

$5.99 for Steak & Eggs (Wheat bread, medium rare steak, over medium eggs for me please!) A perfect place to venture out to after the club at 4AM to help ease the hangover you may have the next day. My favorite part are the crispy hash browns that come with your meal! 

Only one time has our service not been great & it was probably because James was not our waiter. A friend was baffled because he had some blue pieces of fat and let the waitress know. She kind of apologized, but also didn't care. "It's just the blue stamp they put on meat sometimes" & he asked, "Shouldn't they cut it off though?" & she kind of just blew him off. We get it, it's late and tips aren't great on cheap meals.

They do not do split checks between the hours of 4PM & 5AM! So bring cash or bring a friend that has a high credit card balance and Venmo.

Came on Friday for the AYCE crab legs for $20. There will be a wait, but it is definitely worth it. I came with a group of 10 and we have never received this type of service on top of that we were STARVING. Only reason I gave this place 4 stars is because they told us we had a 30 minute wait but it ended up being 1 hour... They will drown you with crabs!! They bring plates of crabs out before you are even finished with your plate! They were delicious   definitely come here if you love crab legs!!

Average.
I had the chicken finger dinner because I too indulge in my childish desires from time to time. They were standard: somewhat dry, very fried, and not something you can quite eat without the assistance of sauces to lessen the scratching of the overly brittled flesh scraping at the inside of your esophagus. 
Mac and cheese was dry as well, mushy, and probably has been sitting under the salamander most of today. I suspect it was gingerly microwaved before it brought to us. 
Fries: probably the best thing. Crispy enough, well seasoned (which the mac and cheese cannot equally boast), and quick to disappear off of the surface of my plate.
Finally dessert: I had the oreo creme cake and my lovely companion had a turtle cheesecake. The oreo creme cake had unfortunately long sucked in the very distinct taste of freezer and was likewise quite cloying (especially with the addition of a saccharine chocolate syrup on the plate for 'decoration'). Turtle cheesecake tasted less like freezer. It was the better of the two for sure.

Overall what we expected. Not a place you're eager to return to.

We read the reviews and thought we would try it.  The wait staff was super friendly and efficient.  They have a Sunday night special, Tbone for 9.99.  They rolls and cornbread is awesome.  We will definitely go back.  The casino was not that smoky.  That is an added bonus.

All those cheap specials that are being advertised on yelp are only at late night or early morning, which caused some disappointment for me as I convinced all my friends we'd have a cheap meal.

I ordered a skillet plate since the special was unavailable and it was packed with goodness. The wait for the food; however, was a little unbearable. We had about 6 people, but we waited around a half hour for our food. They might make you wait so the food can taste better. 

I wouldn't mind coming here again, but I might only come when I find out when that damned steak and eggs special is available.

My friends and I stopped by for our last meal before driving home. The restaurant is located within the Tuscany Casino, a short drive off the strip. We were seated immediately which was nice considering we were hoping to beat some of the traffic. 

It didn't matter though, because our service was terrible. Our waitress, Patty, was the worst server any of us had ever had. She didn't introduce herself for over 20 minutes and failed to provide any reason for being so inattentive. Our food came out another 30 minutes later and was all cold besides the country fried steak. Although cold, the food was pretty tasty. 

Having already watched our neighboring table wait another 30 minutes for their check, we decided to skip the suspense and approach the hostess to pay. We would loved to have express our frustration to Patty herself, but she was too busy using her phone to check on us. Luckily we made sure her manager knew of our discontent.

I would rate this place at 3.5 stars based on my two visits recently. The first time I visited it was about 23:00. I ordered french toast with bacon. The french toast was fine, but the bacon was limp and disgusting. The bacon, also, had a bunch of black specks on it, which I'm assuming is residue from the flat top. Needless to say, I didn't eat the bacon. Totally disgusting. The second time I came by it was about 20:00. I decided to order a club sandwich, despite the earlier issues with their bacon. This time, however, the bacon was fine. I made sure to look at it before eating. It was crisp and without any sign of foreign particulates. The sandwich was damn tasty, and it was a good deal like all their food. So, would I come back? Probably. Marilyn's is one of those old-school Vegas places that still has great prices and pretty solid food, which is becoming a rarity in Vegas these days. Coming here was actually cheaper than eating at the strip's White Castle.

I'd spend the night at Tuscany and got a buy one get one free entree coupon and used it here. The french toast complete is good deal. I'd split it with my sister and we were both full. Service is also vry friendly. Total was ~$8. Great deal if you get the coupon.

Located at the Tuscany Suites, less than 5 minutes away from the strip. And less than 5 dollars to give you the best drunk munchies experience you'll ever have.

For $3.99 from 12 am-5 am, you'd better not think twice to enjoy their steak and eggs. It's the perfect remedy after a long night of drinking. The steak is actually very flavorful, hash browns are crispy and lots of it too, buttery toast, and 2 eggs any you want it! I got loaded has browns (a dollar more) this has gravy and cheese all over it. My medium rare steak with a sunny side egg on top of it to let the yolk just oooze all over it, was so freakin' bombbbb. 

Honestly, one of the biggest reasons I made my recent Vegas trip was solely to have this deliciousness. And I'm lookin' forward to have my fix again.
Ok food. Breakfast is ok. Very slow Service.... Nice place if you don't want to leave the hotel or casino.

Horrible!! Run! The manager is (I'm sorry to say) a fucking idiot! When I complained about my food he said to our waiter "please take the coffee off their bill please" ha what a joke! Never again! Yuck! Everything is frozen and microwaved!!!

The lady at my hotel gave Marilyn's a good recommendation for dinner. So I checked the reviews at yelp which were also good. Unfortunately it was not good at all.

The restaurant is in the back of the Tuscany Casino. It looks nice, sort of like an upscale coffee shop. The server was a little slow to take my order, which was surprising since there were only two people in his section at the time. I ordered the chicken parmesan, which came with garlic toast and spaghetti; no other sides. The wait for the food seemed a little long; again surprising since the crowd wasn't very big. 

The meal was a huge disappointment. I never thought there could be too much cheese on Chicken Parmesan but boy was I wrong. It was completely smothered in goopy greasy mozz. The chicken was obviously a frozen reheat. The pasta was overcooked and soggy (honestly I'm usually okay with overcooked pasta, but not soggy). The sauce was the worst; it definitely tasted canned, almost Chef Boyardee-ish. Yuck!! The only positive was the dinner rolls that were brought to me half way through the meal. The service throughout the meal remained mediocre.

I was tempted to give them a one star... but to be honest, most of the people around me were ordering the prime rib (which was on special) or breakfast items. The prime rib with the salad and baked potato looked delicious and everyone seemed to be enjoying their breakfasts. And as you can see there is a multitude of positive reviews here at Yelp.  So I gave them the benefit of the doubt and TWO STARS.

Update: Not sure why, but I went back for breakfast a few days later.  The breakfast wasn't bad.  Again, the place was busy and everybody seemed to be very happy with their meals.  So, maybe I was just unlucky with the Chicken Parm.  However, the two stars still stands.

If I could put negative stars I would.

I came here based on the good reviews, I was severely disappointed. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my fiancé ordered the steak and eggs. While my fiancé said the steak was good, that is where the compliments end. I also ordered the corned-beef hash which arrived with a big long blonde hair in it. Needless to say I was disgusted. My server looked at me and asked if I wanted a new one. No apology, no visit from the manager. Nothing. I said no thank you and tried to eat the rest of my food. My fiancé had ordered a bagel, which after asking two times never showed up. After pointing this out to our server she appeared to realize her tip was in jeopardy and wrote us off. With an eye-roll she walked away and did not come back to refill drinks or ask how our food was. My food was cold and a bit salty. Another friend of ours got the fires with gravy. He stated they were just "ok". 

I am really not getting all the positive reviews for this place. Service was awful, managers were MIA, no attempt to remedy the problems or care that we were happy in the slightest. Avoid at all costs. There are way too many choices in Vegas to settle for this mediocrity.

Good food for the money.  Located inside the Tuscany Casino.

We ate here over the course of our three day stay while attending a convention.  Average price ranged from $7-10.   You can't go wrong.

Pros - plenty of seating.  Solid American food.  Cheap and plenty.

Cons - food served fairly lukewarm like my pancakes and corn beef hash.

Opened 24 hours daily.  Lots of to go orders.

This place was great for being open at 1 o'clock in the morning and for the value of the food. We had the eggs and steak and hashbrowns for five dollars which is a fantastic deal. We did have a trouble ordering a beer for some reason it confused the staff. We waited quite a while for the food but we had no complaints given it was so late and we were so hungry. The value and the atmosphere were good. One thing I would not recommend if you are sensitive to smoke - there was a lot of cigarette smokers inside the casino. 

Food quality was really only 3.5 stars.

After a coworker found this on yelp and tasted the steak and eggs, I felt I had to try this place. One word comes to mind: impressive. 

A very warm and inviting atmosphere with a good view of the casino. It's a casual dinner witch is always a plus and also does room service for the hotel. 

Avoid a-la-carte items as these appeared a little heavy to me for a dinner. However the special menus(daily and lunch were VERY attractive.

The prime rib was sensational. Something I'd expect out of a higher end steak house. I asked for it rare and got it that way which was very pleasing. The horseradish was a nice balance of spivey and flavor. The greens and mashed potatoes were fresh and cooked just right. 

The service was just as good as the food and I'll probably be back a few more times this week!

I'm from the south. The country fried steak was on point! The grits were watery, but good. Eggs, phenomenal! Service, spot on. Hashbrowns, tasty. Coffee was mediocre but drinkable. It's more pricy than its listed, more like $$ but no big deal. Decor is relaxing and comfortable.

Amazing steak and eggs!  My BF actually liked the steak better than what he had at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill.  And for about half the price of what you'd pay at most of the other more well known casinos.  Service is friendly and super fast.  Great diner food...they also have comfort food (pasta, pizza, etc) and everything else looked really good too.

Sloooow service. Definitely not coming back here since it's not worth it. If you want to have a late night meal go to Tacos el gordo, it's definitely worth it and very affordable. 

When we got here I can already see they were busy and understaffed. Took 10 minutes for someone to come up to us and greet us, by then we were already set on the steak and egg deal that I thought was $4.99. 

Steak and eggs was nothing  extraordinary, Norms is much better than what I was served. They over buttered my English muffins to the point where I scraped a few good chunks off. The steak was asked for medium rare and was over cooked to well. It was decent but nothing to get excited over. Had to use hot sauce and salt for more flavor. I ordered my eggs over medium since I love it runny and that was surprisingly cooked perfectly. I like combining it with the steak or hash brown, it helps give different texture. Eventually we finished our meal but service was no where to be found for a refill of water. I just grabbed my sister's water and finished it. Eventually we flagged our waiter to get the check and paid our way.

@TuscanyCasino #Vegas Friday Night All-You-Can-Eat Crab Legs $12.99!!! WOW

A small diner located in this off the strip casino offering 24/7 dining with breakfast,lunch and dinner plus DAILY specials. Great Prices, Great Service and good food....Plus Food Coupons for locals in the newspaper:)

We decided to dine out for Crab Night and enjoyed 4 plates (probably 5+lbs) of HOT crab legs with HOT drawn butter plus I ordered a Prime Rib with Baked Potato.

The food was good. The crab was really good nice and HOT!! :) The Prime Rib was a little bland however-no real seasoning but still decent. 3 people dining out for under $40!!
Good food. Good value. Good service. Enough said :) The only downfall is that it's not close to home...
The food compliments the service. Kudos to Arnold, great customer service with a sense of humor. Food is reasonably priced. Overall good experience!

This is a late review, but this was a memorable spot from my weekend in Vegas some months ago.

They have this late night special where they have steak, hashbrowns, eggs, and toast for $5!  The girls and I did this two nights in a row, and if the weekend was longer we probably would have been back again.  I have never had any of the other food, but I've heard that it's also decent.  

Next time you're leaving a club/party with drunchies (drunk munchies), come here for an affordable and filling meal.

I think my expectations for this restaurant were a little to high.... for someone who was completely sober and hungry at 6:00a. I ordered 1 multi- grain pancake with fruit. I literally waited 25 minutes for 1 pancake. It was 100% tasteless. I even douzed it in syrup and butter to taste a little flavor... still nothing. Service friendly but definetly not efficient.

i miss this SO much about las vegas!!!  

i went to UNLV for a year and a half and this is definitely a highlight of my collegiate career in las vegas.  after midnight until 5 am there are a bunch of specials.  the best one is the steak and eggs!  when i was there, it was only $2.99 but its a dollar more now but hey, its still a great deal.  you get two eggs, two slices of toast, hash browns, and steak!  LOVE IT!  there was this one lady that always served us.  she had a dude's name but she's super cool!  

for anyone going to vegas, this is definitely a place to hit up!  marilyn's cafe is inside of the tuscany hotel.  i recommend this place to EVERYONE visiting vegas!!

Honestly, I've only eaten at Marilyn's on several occasions-- and each encounter was between the late (or early) hours of midnight- 4am. They are known for their late night steak and eggs special... for the very low price of $4.99! For $4.99 you get an order of steak, eggs, hash browns and toast. Portions are not huge, though satisfying-- option for a double order steak and eggs available for about $10. The late night steak and eggs special is not on the menu, but very much so available. Their thick, creamy clam chowder is also tasty and very filling! Despite being open 24 hours and numerous drunken encounters throughout the night, all of the employees here are wonderful! In addition to this, if you are sober enough to drive yourself here (don't drink and drive!), Marilyn's parking is easy peasy-- located right outside the Casino. No complicated parking structure to venture through. Marilyn's is perfect for late night, cheap eats.

Service was excellent! Price is very affordable! I ordered the fetuccini Alfredo, and I gotta say, it's one of the tastiest I've tried! I would've gave this place 5 stars if the steaks my friends ordered wasn't so over cooked and dry. So I suggest if you want your steak medium-well, just get medium. If you want it medium, then get medium-rare, and so on..

The food was terrible.  Everything we ordered had absolutely no flavor, very bland.  I would have rather gone to denny's or IHOP and gotten way better food.  It didn't really seem like some other people in the restaurant were really enjoying their food.  The service was not really the greatest either.  I will definitely not be back,  I'll spend my money elsewhere.

$5.99 steak and egg special!  We came here because it was cheaper than at Ellis Island haha (only by $1 though).  It was pretty great to finally try a midnight/late night steak and egg meal, and we are happy we came to this restaurant.

The meal came with steak, eggs, hash browns, and buttery toast, with plenty of jam to go with it :D  It was definitely a great meal and a great deal!

Ate here several times while staying at the Tuscany.  It's inside the casino.  Great specials every day and great inexpensive breakfasts.  Was able to fill up and get out quickly.  Highly recommended for standard diner fare.

This is based off my second visit the first time I wasn't too impressed with the service but they made up for it tonight !!! All u can eat crab legs for $20 Friday night can't beat it !!! Come early there will
Be a wait. Food is good service was Great !!

The food here is delicious. My bbq chicken was sooo tender it fell right off the bone. My mashed potatoes and mac n cheese were creamy and well seasoned. My dinner was only $9.99. My husband's breakfast was only $8.99. You won't regret stopping here.

$5.99 for a (approximately) 12 oz. steak, 2 eggs, hash browns, and 4 pieces of toast. Whether you win or lose on the strip, it's a great place to celebrate or eat your sorrows away, respectively.

I don't know if there are better locales and how Marilyn's compares, but if I'm ever back in Vegas, you'll find me here after midnight.

STEAK AND EGGS.  The one thing you have to do in Vegas is get steak and eggs at like 3am.  

We came on Friday night after XS.  Driving it isn't too far from the strip, about 5 minutes or so and plenty of parking.  It's located in the Tuscany hotel and casino.

PARKING: Free, huge parking lot.

ATMOSPHERE: Has that denny's/ihop feel to it but we got a big booth for 8 of us and were seated right away.

FOOD: Coming at 2:30am they had the steak and eggs special.  I didn't see it on the menu but just ask for it and the waiter will get it for you.  I think it was $4.99 or $5.99 but either way very cheap.  Ask for it more rare than you normally order it because it is pretty thin and they tend to overcook the meat.  I got medium rare and it was only pink.  

The platter comes with steak, 2 eggs, hash browns and 4 pieces of toast (you can choose).  I got the eggs over easy and they were runny but not gross.  I got sourdough toast, where they put the butter on it for you and it was SO GOOD.  The hash browns were tasty, not bland and hard but still hot and crispy.

The steak was OK, as you can imagine for such a cheap price, but the flavoring wasn't bad.  It was just slightly tough.

Overall, definitely a must for your trip to Vegas.

We eat breakfast here quite often and dinner less. The french toast complete would be my morning recommendation. If you want real scrambled eggs instead of egg substitute you need to specify country scramble. Service is usually decent but the turn over at the cashier station sometimes causes delays as they are often training new people. Often have specials which are a bargain.

My husband and I love love marilyn's cafe!  He get's the steak and I get the prime rib, we also love the garden salad and shrimp cocktail. This may will be our 3rd year in a row staying at Tuscany (because we love it) and our 3rd year in a row eating at Marilyn's Cafe. Honestly as we plan our trip in Vegas this is always our first anniversary dinner choice. You gotta try it! Delicious!

Our service was generally good. Despite the ravings here, I would say it's just OK. The food was adequate but certainly not "made with love" as my partner put it who came for their steak and eggs. The plates are huge which was literally awkward when they put one slice of French toast on it next to your eggs. We asked for no toast but it still was on the plate but once removed the spinach omelette look sad & small. The prices were inexpensive for Vegas but it's an example of getting what you paid for.

WHAT?? $4 steak and eggs you say?? Yeees, I heard you right!

The steak and eggs were SOOOOOO good after a night at the club! Definitely worth the $4! They give you a strip of steak, 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and a lot of toast but be careful eating those as you will get full before you eat the rest of the plate! I asked for my steak medium and they did the cooking right! The bbq sauce on the table is so good with it! My eggs sunnyside up and again they did that right. Can't really go wrong with eggs though. The hashbrowns were so good with the crunch on the top. Throw some ketchup and tabasco on those babies and they're perfect!

We also got the gravy fries. Those were amazing as well. We didn't finish them though because we were all full from our steak and eggs.

This will definitely be my early morning spot when I come back to Vegas. I love that they're open 24 hrs. 

Taxis don't frequent this hotel since it's not on the strip. My friends and I didn't really know what to do to get back to our hotel. Luckily a few minutes after we went outside a taxi came to drop some people off so we took that back to our hotel. I'm pretty sure you can go inside to ask the concierge if they could call a taxi for you though!

Eh, second time here and service is terrible but cheap food. I ordered the turkey pot pie & it tasted like something was moldy inside. I returned it and ate only a side of hash browns. Only reason I give it three stars is because my boyfriends food was good but over all the place is mediocre at best.

I went for their Steak & Eggs late night special for $4.99. Specials run from midnight 12am to 5am. Heard about from Yelp when having hunger pangs late at night during a Las Vegas vacation.

The special come with a strip steak (cooked medium, my preference), two eggs to your liking (mine is sunny side up), hash browns shredded-style, and toasts. Sure hits the spot and satisfies!

I think some previous reviewers of the Friday Night Crab Leg Special must be deaf. If not, they will be if they continue to visit here. Wow, so loud we could not hold a conversation at our table.
Crab legs were so-so. Decent portions, but the legs themselves were smallish.
Service was spotty. They were busy, so I'll cut a little slack.
Overall, I'll be looking for a different crab leg spot.....

Have been there twice now on their All You Can Eat Crab night. The food, the service, the atmosphere (buffet) are all superb! The Manager, Aldo Mencatto, and his staff are fun, courteous, helpful, and attentive. The food is fantastic. And the price - well, you can't go wrong. Definitely a place I look forward to visiting again.

After a successful night of clubbing in early October, my friend said he was going to The Tuscany to get $4.99 steak and eggs and offered to bring some back for me. I'd never heard of such a thing and was skeptical about how good a $5 steak would be. I also don't like eating late at night but he told me I'd regret it if I didn't.

I was starving by the time he got back since I stayed up waiting for him to return. My take-out box had steak, eggs, hashbrowns, and toast. The steak, to be honest, was barely edible and had a ton of fat. Another friend, who was also starving, thought it was delicious and ate most of it. The eggs were scrambled, pretty bland, and could've used some salt. So... why 4 stars?

The Loaded Hashbrowns -- it's $1 more to get them loaded, but do it anyway (uh, it's only a $1). I can promise you you won't regret it, because it's the most delightfully delicious concoction of hashbrowns, gravy, cheese, and only God knows what else (crack?); especially when you're starving at 4 AM. I'd pay $5.99 just for these hashbrowns alone.

So, go. Marilyn's steak obviously won't be the best you've ever had, but for $5, who's complaining?

Wandered in around 11 pm and inhaled my yearly dose of second hand smoke in the hour I waited for the graveyard special to start. Totally worth it.
Two eggs
Two pieces of toast
Hashbrowns 
Steak medium rare
$6.48 including tax.
Crazy.

I am staying here at the Tuscany Suites for the first time and was glad that they had a 24 hour restaurant on site. Unfortunately, the wait staff is completely rude and forgetful. They will gladly seat you without ever sending a waiter over. They do not smile during service and only come around to take your order, drop the food off, and pick up the plates. No refills and no inquiries as to how the experience is going.

Wife and I were looking for a good breakfast, but something more affordable than the $40 per person buffets at the Wynn and the like. 

Marilyn's had good reviews, and was a $8 cab ride from where we were staying, so we made the trip.

It's inside the casino at the Tuscan hotel, and the restaurant itself is a perfect match for the food - simple, comfortable, and good. 

My wife had the meet lovers bowl, and I had the NY steak and eggs. The food came quick, the temperature was good, and almost everything tastes great. 

The only food item I didn't like was the steak, as it lacked flavor - very bland. But the grits and eggs and toast were all so good, I kind of ignored it. 

The service was fast and friendly, and we recommend Marilyn's to anyone looking for a decent breakfast at a decent price.

We had the French Toast special for breakfast on July 9, 2014.  Two big pieces of French Toast, two eggs cooked to order, bacon, and sausage for $5.99.  Great deal.  I wish we had found them sooner in our trip.  I would have liked to try more of their food.

Decent food and big portions. Slow but friendly service. Have to walk through the smoky casino to get to the cafe. They have a service charge of 18% if you have 6 or more people (which I think is ridiculous!).

The atmosphere here was really dreary and depressing. Most of the staff looked absolutely miserable. Our waitress was inattentive and had to be reminded to bring us part of our meal. Seemed like she was drunk, too, but who knows. The drinks that we ordered were on the weak side. Everything took a long time. The food came out hot and was good, and the prices are fair. I want to give them 3 stars because the food was good, but I feel that 3 stars implies that I might return here. Wouldn't go back.
Service was stupid. Watched a take out carton get dropped off and sit at the counter for 10 minutes until someone finally gave it to me. Nothing like cold food. No apology. Terrible service.

Went here late so food review might be a little off.   The place is good size with nice wait staff and the kitchen was quick.  We had steak and eggs and everyone was happy.  The deal of the night was all you can eat pancakes.   Who doesn't like pancakes at 2am.  Great little find.

Definitely a fan.

The food was above average for an excellent price.

I was confused on where it was, but it is in the casino/resort.

Go to the back......... park..... enter and eat.

On my last day at Vegas I wanted to eat somewhere affordable. I found Marilyn's at the Tuscany and I can't believe how amazing the food is. Their steak and eggs are great and my kids loved the pancakes. Even my wife left vegas happy because of her breakfast there. Thank you Marilyn's and staff we will be visiting the next time we're in

Went to Marilyn's Café on Friday for their all you can eat crab legs. Have been there before, and the food was good, but the servers were so busy they couldn't spend much time. Sort of threw food at you. This time though, John, our server, was outstanding. He was right there when we sat down, asked for our drink order and didn't wait for the busser to bring them. Asked if we were still having crab legs, as we go there EVERY FRIDAY for them. We said yes, and he brought the bucket, my extra lemon and extra napkins before we even ordered it. Dinner was served promptly and he kept the crab legs coming, even asking if I wanted more just before I was finished with first order so second order would be there right as I was done. (So we wouldn't have to wait, since they were so busy). John is one of the best servers in the bunch. We have been there numerous times at different days and times since we are locals, and John ALWAYS knows what we are drinking and usually has some idea of what we are going to want to eat. He makes sure our drinks are always full, and if the bussers are busy he even clears the table so we don't have a bunch of plates piling up. If you want excellent food and extraordinary and attentive service, GO TO MARILYN'S CAFE AND ASK FOR JOHN.(he only works nights)

Let me start by saying "I Love sea food". So when my husband takes me to an all you can eat crab legs im in heaven.  
The restaurant was very clean and it was nice, Tuscany Casino is a small casino compared to what you expect to see near the strip. I wasn't sure on what to expect, but i was very pleased. If you order all you can eat crab legs and you want bread, you need to ask. They will only bring you bread when you ask. 
The crab legs where delicios and warm/hot, which i love. You get to pick 2 sides. I got green beans and mash potatoes, both were great. 

I'm giving them 4 stars because it took them a little while to bring more crab legs and also for soda refills. The waiter was really nice, I could tell that she got very busy and she was going back between tables. It's fine with me, i worked at a restaurant before and i understant how that can be. Over all great experience and the price is only $19.99 per person. *plus drinks

3.99 steak and egg only for midnight to 5am! We walked in  this place in the afternoon. Regular price everything and tastes so so.  You can find better food with lower price in a lot other restaurants in Vegas such as Ellis island!  And service in this place is terrible no energy at all! 2 stars for the bread and butter.....

Steggs - steak and eggs.

After a long night of clubbing and shenanigans in Vegas, stop by Marilyn's and have their $5 steak and eggs special. You get steak and eggs prepared the way you want them, hash browns (order them extra crispy!), and toast. Very delicious, filling, and cheap - just the way I like it!

This place and the management are a joke. I argued with the staff for a good 15 mins about having French toast. Asked to speak to a manager and was refused. Instead the manager sits and stuffs his face while he tells the server to go tell me he's unavailable.  The strangest part about it all is I even offered to pay the difference from the start of the whole argument.  No mater what I had to take the meal the way it was served on the menu.
I miss Tuscany ever since I moved. This place was a late night favorite for me after all the geeky magic get together a. Everything is fairly priced and delicious. The steak and eggs are a must!

Cafe with inexpensive specials. Had the steak and lobster, lobster wasn't bad at all for 4oz and the steak had some gristle to it but was edible. Service was lacking and my beer was just brought in the bottle to drink out of, should have been offered a glass before bringing it out and just setting it on the table. Green beans were so crunchy and inedible that when I told the waitress I was surprised she didn't offer to bring me something else since I didn't eat them; she just said "I'll let the kitchen know so they can cook them longer".  doesn't do me any good

I'm gonna go out on a whim and say you stumbled onto this restaurant by searching for 'steak and eggs'. High five for you! 

Nothing says you've had a good night like some $4.99 steak and over easy yolk-porn.  It's a guarantee that the entire plate will be devoured in under 5 minutes. Time me if you don't believe me. heheh 

Don't complain about slow service and stop being picky about the quality. it's $4.99 and you're drunk, so just be happy and enjoy the rest of your night.
The crab legs for 12.99 along with two sides on Friday are delish.. also the 16 oz steak is great. fast service and the food is so well prepared for the price.
My husband and I always stay at the Tuscany.  Suites are very nice and most importantly Marilyns Cafe is delicious!  Great service amazing food all in one!
Great place to have all your meals, they open 24/7, serve breakfast all day. cool AC
Lives up to the hype! Fresh food and great service. Why eat on the strip when you can pay and get exactly what you pay for. No overpriced meals so tip well because your server deserves it.

Steak and Eggs! Steak and Eggs! Steak and Eggs!

Definitely get the steak and eggs. They are bomb and so affordable. You cant get this good of a deal anywhere else on the strip. The sourdough bread was also bomb. I enjoyed everything about my sober late night foodie escapade. The only thing that might be discouraging is the walk to the restaurant. It's a little ways off from the strip, but it's for sure in walking distance.

First time I came here for $5 steak and eggs it was bomb. 
2nd time it was good, but the first time was better. 

$5 steak and eggs though. 
Eggs, steak, buttery toast, hash browns, 67 sauce. 

Vegas: Drink, party, clubs...4 AM....Steak and eggs.

I thought I already wrote a review of this place, but I guess not.

Great place.  I ate here twice while staying at my new favorite hotel/casino, Tuscany Resort.

This restaurant is open 24/7 and the food is great.  The presentation is wonderful too!  Even with just $2 steak and eggs, it is served up in a fashion fit for a king!

The pizza's were pretty good too.

I would definitely stop eat here again!

$4.99 late night steak and eggs!

We used to take a $25 (one way!) cab ride to South Point for their $2.95 steak and eggs. But since I discovered this spot, I'll definitely be going here instead of alllllll the way to South Point.

It took a while before we got our food, but the wait was worth it. Steak, eggs, hash browns, and sourdough toast. Perfect after a night out of drinking and dancing. Oh, and the fact that it's only $4.99 makes it better.

Check this spot out for the late night s&e cravings. It's located at the Tuscany Inn which is a block behind Bally's. Not far from the main strip!
Great food.  The best waiter ever is James. Very nice courteous funny and sweet. Great food drunk or sober!
I change mind, this place is the BOMB BAY! The steak special is cheap and delicious!

For the past two hours, I've been struggling to understand why (and how) this place is so highly reviewed! I had the Turkey George... Egg white omelette with thinly sliced turkey and an avocado verde sauce. My boyfriend had the Belgium waffle topped with cinnamon apples. My best friend had two chocolate chip/strawberry pancakes with a side of hash browns. My omelette lacked so much flavor and the turkey was painfully dry. The avocado verde sauce was DECENT but, in all honesty, I can do a better job in my own kitchen. My boyfriends waffle wasn't any better. I think he would've been happier with a stack of Eggos. And my best friend described her pancakes as "no better than iHop." Not to mention, her hash browns were drenched in oil. Our meal was not worth the price. I would have rather bought groceries and cooked breakfast on my own in my hotel room. 

The ONE upside, (which is why I had to give two stars instead of one), is that they will bring you complimentary bread upon request. The corn bread is to die for and the dinner rolls are delicious as well.

I still wouldn't return. But just to help you out... Request the bread!

This is our go to spot every time we hit up vegas. Its located in Tuscany Suites.. The hotel itself is on the older side and not the greatest filtration system when it comes to the cigarette smoke, but the restaurant itself doesn't carry the smell. The food is great and decently priced. Service is good, the prices have gone up over the years but understandable. Good place to go when you are looking for a quick bite. The prime rib is good (best medium) if they have it available for purchase.

Loooooooooove  Marilynns , always on point excellant food and staff, forget the strio resataunts tourist traps , im gonna write guy fiery a letter saying "weve been to Marilynns.....we want our money back"  lol the burger at Marilynns distroys any on the strip and its only like 8.49 , dont be a tourist get over to Marilynns and see for yourself

== Review is just for the Steak & Eggs ==

Everytime i hit up sin city I have to have Steak & Eggs. Love Love Love em!!!
By far of all the spots I've tried close to the strip, Marilyn's Cafe is by far the best (aside from Mr. Lucky's 24-7) in terms of cost & quality. It's nothing super duper special but a great place to get your fix. 

Very friendly servers. Service is pretty on spot here except one time they were super super slow and the restaurant was 3/4 empty. By not means is this an upscale, fancy cafe. There is no modern decor nor an ambiance. Just a simple, old-school cafe & serves yummy bfast. There are various tables & booth seatings.


:: FOOD ::

STEAK & EGGS BFAST SPEICAL    (5/5)
 - Price of $8.99 (6AM -11AM Daily)
 - 6oz tender NY Strip
 - 2 eggs any style
 - Hasbrowns, Toast or 2 Pancakes

OJ    (2.5/5)
 - not fresh squeezed, taste wise mehhhh.... wouldn't order again.

COFFEE   (3/5)
 - very light roasted taste, sorta does the work just to get the morning going

Marilyn's is one of my favorite go-to breakfast/brunch spots in Vegas because it's the perfect amount of food for extremely fair prices! Friends I've brought here after a late night of adventures all agree that Marilyn's hits the spot! See you in October :)

Good quality breakfast, cheap prices, and very attentive service. Yelp saved the day again.

Surprisingly, the cafe wasn't crowded for a Saturday morning.

Okay. So it's no Morton's or Flemings, but for $8.99 for a decent 8oz steak cooked perfectly MR which I was actually shocked. Two eggs toast and potatoes it was most differently worth the money. My server was very obliging and polite. 
I give it a strong four stars.
Had the eggs benedict eggs cooked to perfection hash browns on the side I highly recommend this place very good food the coffee is very good too

Looked up a place to have a good and inexpensive dinner, when we found this place on yelp we decided to try it out. 
Located in the quaint, friendly and clean Tuscany Suites Casino it is truly a great place to enjoy some very good food, quaint and homely atmosphere. We were sat at our table very quickly, our waiters were very friendly and provided the specials of the day. Our food came out rather quickly and we were very happy with our choices. We had dinner and came back for breakfast the next morning. We enjoyed our food very much and will definitely be going back again.

I've only been here between the hours of 1-4am, but you can't really beat $5.99 steak and eggs after a long night of drinking and dancing at the club. 

The plate comes with a good-portioned steak, hash browns, 2 eggs (any way you like), 2 whole slices of toast (white, wheat, sourdough). I usually order it, medium rare, over-easy or sunny side up eggs with sourdough bread. 

TIPS: Dip the toast in the runny egg yolk for that next level deliciousness. 

You get what you pay for, but this hits the spot every time, I've always left feeling satisfied. Plus, I've never had to wait, so definitely my #1 recommendation for late night bites at a very affordable price.

Anyone below who knocks this place...well I cannot not think of any other plausible reason other than they are just not smart and are expecting the moon and stars from a 24-hr café at an off the strip casino/hotel.

The place is clean, well lit, and décor was satisfactory. The service was just right. Only coming back when plates were clearly done or to refill beverages which clearly needed to be filled; and they were friendly about it.

The food was pretty darn good. The $3.95 all day all you can eat pancakes are beyond adequate for that price. The steak and eggs special, while not on the level to make Gordon Ramsay not scream, were very good for the price and you got to pancakes as a side. The steak was a bit thin and had some more fat on it thenI would have liked, but nothing to cry about. The eggs weren't perfect, but having been to Vegas 8 times in 6 years and having 40+ breakfasts, I am yet to find good eggs. So I was not unhappy. I didn't get sick and they looked/tasted like eggs. Little ketchup and Tabassco did wonders (as they usually do).

My group also, took part in the all-you-can eat crab legs on Friday night for $16.95. We took down 100+ legs. None of us were sick or even felt uncomfortable...just full. Again, not the best I have ever had, but really, quality shell fish in Vegas is hard to come-by (I live in CT, good seafood is a staple in my neck of the woods, so I am spoiled...very few places in Vegas come even close to what I experience on the norm).

I will agree with one Yelper down below...BRING YOUR OWN WATER. The water was a bit funky. It may be the local filtration process, I do not know. But after a 'long night in Vegas', water the next morning is clutch. Not from here though.

I would give this 4.5 stars if possible. But I went with 4, because of the Water thing, and the steaks were a 'tad underwhelming' (that may be too harsh, but it is the best I can think of). Definitely check this place out if you are on or near Flamingo at or East of the Strip.

Just to be clear, in my experience, there is one thing and one thing only to go to Marilyn's Cafe for, and that is the graveyard breakfast specials. It certainly isn't the service -- it's absolutely ridiculous how terrible the service has been here. In fact, there was one time among the twenty other times we've dined here when we were waited on by a lady who received a 100% tip from us, and all she did was do her job. That's it. It was just such a pleasant change for us, we decided to let her know. A lot.
