The graveyard breakfast specials aren't bad, and the price is outrageously cheap. Steak 'n eggs, taters, and toast -- $2.99. Pancakes or two eggs 'n toast -- $0.99.  Perfect place to go after a night on the town. Just, like I said, be patient with the servers.

I love this place! Located in the Tuscany casino, this is definitely a hidden gem. Marilyn's is a traditional cafe that is open 24 hours. They also serve breakfast all day. This place has amazing food at very cheap prices. The quality of food is very good, and the service is always above average. 

Gluten free options: They offer some gluten free options, such as gluten free pancakes (they are very good), and also have options such as scrambles, omelets, sandwiches w/ no bun. They do not have a specific menu, but they do offer some options, and they are happy to make substitutions.  

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for good food at a very reasonable price!

Awesome awesome awesome!

My whole family is a huge fan of the midnight special.  Steak and eggs, $4.99, and the quality can't be beat!  We stop in every time we come to Vegas.

My kid is a night owl and even if we are dragging on our first night in Vegas, she'll ask us to stay up and go.  And we wind up happy about it every time!  On our last trip, two years ago, the steak was good.  Now it's a dollar more for the special, and the steak is great!

And the rest.  This restaurant can actually deliver an egg over easy.  It's perfect every time.  The toast, buttery and filling.  Hash browns, nice and tasty, well cooked and not overdone.

You need to know what's on at what time when you come in.  The $4.99 special is midnight to 5 AM, but a regular breakfast special for $7.99 is available mornings.  Or fill up on pancakes for...memory is a bit dim but I think it's $3.99 around the clock.

Be sure to tip your waiter on something like what the actual price would be.  Service is good and regular, ours always keep our drinks filled.

Hit the casino for laughs with the Judge Judy slots behind the cafe, or just hit the video poker up the aisle.

#150

I was in Lost Wages, err Las Vegas for 2016 CES and staying next door at the Fortune Hotel. FYI, don't stay there (I will detail that experience later).

I went to Marilyn's for breakfast the first day of CES, Wednesday, 6 January. I tried the chicken fried steak and eggs with real shredded hash browns and my friend got the pork chop and eggs. We shared and the hostess had recommended the latter as one of her favourites. Good choice! The chicken fried steak was lightly breaded and the chicken so tender; the pork chops were so tender you could cut them with a stick pen. I thought the coffee was excellent but my friend thought it was average. José and Miriam took care of us this meal (one of 4 trips in 4 days). Excellent service with excellent food!

Next trips, my friend and I got the Steak and eggs which are $5.99 after midnight and $8.99 between 0600 and 1100. Great steak! Emilia and German took care of us and again, excellent service.

These meals also come with hash browns AND your choice of toast and jams.

Because of this restaurant, next trip we will be staying at the Tuscany which houses this restaurant.

Good food, good price, good portion, good location, good service. Now, that is my 5 stars; get yours soon!

We tried this restaurant on our last morning in Vegas for breakfast because it had such great reviews! We were NOT disappointed. The service was great, the staff, especially our waiter Oscar, was very courteous and attentive, the food was delicious and the portions were huge! All for a very low price! I wish we were here another night so we could try the infamous $5 steak and eggs. Definitely worth it! Oh, and the coffee was exceptional, coming I'm a coffee snob who thinks Starbucks is overrated!

I love coming here for the five dollar steak and eggs. And the attached casino is pretty awesome as well. Great servers, a good selection of food at a reasonable price is never a bad combination. Everytime im in vegas i always make sure to drop by here.

I'm a Fan!! 
The first morning that we were in LV, we came in for Breakfast. I had the 8oz steak and sunnyside Eggs with hashbrowns. It was DELICIOUS!! The service was friendly, and quick. 

We came on Friday 8/15 for the AYCE Crab Legs. The wait was about 30-45 minutes (which was not a problem being a Friday night in Vegas), and there is so much commotion and noise (OH, but SO worth it for $19.99). 

**** Can I suggest a quick weekly STAFF MEETING to organize the chaos to be expected on a Friday night AYCE Crab legs meal??  It really was sheer chaos. We had several different waiters take our order, bring our order, refill our cups, etc.. I was confused on who the hell to tip @ the end of the night so We ended up leaving the $$ on the table, and let them fend for themselves.  

Upon my next return to LV, I will be visiting Marilyn's again

We came to Marilyn's Cafe on a tip from a local (THANKS HOLLY!) and we were satisfied. The decor is very pleasant reminiscent of an outdoor cafe along the coast of Greece. 

The food is great. It was so good we ate here two days. On our first day we came for breakfast. My hubby had breakfast and I opted for a patty melt. The patty melt was de-lish-ous! It was well seasoned and just enough of a portion where I didn't feel like I was overeating. 

On our second day we came for lunch. I had the shrimp skewer (which came with 12 very large shrimp). The prices are very reasonable also. You will not be disappointed visiting the place. 2 thumbs up

We were looking for a good place for breakfast and found Marilyn's on yelp. I ordered Eggs Benedict and they were perfect. Large servings of food and great prices. We were here around 9 am and it was busy but no wait to be seated. Our waitress, Rebecca, was very friendly and kept our coffee cups full! I'd definitely come back again for breakfast! Compared to other 24 hour Vegas cafes this is one of the best - clean, comfortable and a great value.
never dissapointing at alll absolutely the best staff also/.....

All you can eat crab leg Friday.....the crab was cold but good, the sides were not as good the first two times we were here and we sat by the beverage station and it had this smell that wasn't pleasant I'm sure it was all the crab legs they were boiling. Still the service was great as always. I would suggest bringing your own cracking instrument as they have this little plastic one that doesn't really work.  My husband was jealous of this young lady at another table, who was eating her crab while she was talking and bringing out huge pieces of crab everytime.  I took a picture of him because he was so hilarious.  Needless to say this was his first time eating crab legs and he didn't get stuffed or even full. Next time we'll bring pliers and do it right so he can get stuffed.

Been here twice and have only ordered one thing: $3.99 steak and eggs. Will you believe me if I say the steak is pretty tasy, even when I'm sober?  Ok, I've never tried it sober but I imagine it would be just as good. Get the sourdough toast and slab the orange maramalade and butter ontop. 

Greasy, drunk food on the cheap. Gotta love it.

The CLASSIC FAMOUS steak and eggs places in ALL of Vegas. One of my staple Vegas post-midnight places to eat. They serve steak and eggs until 5am. I miss the days when it was only $3.99, and $5 will get you in and out with tax and tip. It is more like $5.99 + tax and tip now, but still full of all its glory and deliciousness, especially a hectic night of Vegas shenanigans. Definitely will be back next time!

First time here, nice quaint casino... I ordered the breakfast croissant and it came with hasbrowns.  It was tasty and plentiful.  The decaf coffee was really good and the waitress was very accommodating.  I like it here.  I enjoyed the gambling too.
Not much on ambiance but the food is spectacular. It's the classic old Vegas specials but they are so good here.large, tasty portions and great service. Ya a winner.

Don't let the Denny's-like decor fool you, this place is the bombbbb diggity.

$5 dollar steak and eggs, SAY WHAT?!  It's not really advertised you just order it, only available from 12am-5am. Soooo either stay up or stay out so you don't miss out on this super awesome deal.  

You know what they say, the early bird gets the the worm! Well, in this case...a steak cooked to your liking (medium-rare ftw!), crispy hashbrowns, two eggs prepared on your word (over easy done right!), and two full slices of toast smeared in butterrrr (white, wheat, rye, sourdough).

Hungry hippo, you're welcome.
Drunk ass, you're welcome.

(I am both of these, so no judgment here!!)
It's a very basic 24/7 restaurant. Not worthy of 4 stars. Nothing spectacular about it and just decent grub when you need it. Not worth the trip unless you are staying here.

I got the spinach mushroom and feta cheese omelette and my bf got the steak and eggs special. The omelette was good but his stake was meh. The hash browns however were an easy 5 stars. Coffee was average. Overall I think the food was 3 stars. 

We went for breakfast around 8:30am on a Friday morning and the noise level was ridiculous. I guess it's expected for the amount of people at the restaurant but it's a little annoying. Service was ok. Tried to get a coffee refill and I just gave up after asking a couple of people. I guess it's expected for how busy the place is. Our waitress seemed to be handling 20 tables.

Overall, this is your overage American breakfast place. Nothing exceptional. Would probably come here again if in the area BEFORE 7 am.

Price was great for all-you can eat pancakes - honestly though, I couldn't even finish the first plate - they are huge.  I got a side of corned beef hash too and it was A-OK by me (as was the coffee).  I ordered my pancakes as the 'red, white and blue' style - which means strawberries, bananas, and blueberries.. the bizarre thing (which I did not like) was that they actually mixed all the fruit into the batter - so I got pancakes full of mushy cooked fruit.  I guess it was ok, but not my favorite and not what I expected - I thought the fruit would be on top of regular pancakes.  Oh well.  Service was nice and quick.  I definitely don't mind stopping in here for food whenever I am staying at Tuscany and need to get a quick bite.

We stayed at Tuscany for several days and we enjoyed the meals at Marilyns. Portions are huge. 

I had the french toast breakfast, which was delicious. Husband had the steak and eggs with pancakes for $6.99. Can't beat the price. The steak was properly cooked, but it could have used a bit more salt. For dinner, I tried the baked ziti. So good! Like super good. I crave it. Husband had the salmon which was also cooked perfectly. I will be back here the next time we are in LV. Glad we found Tuscany and even more glad we found Marilyns.

BEST STEAK & EGGS SPOT IN VEGAS! YEEEAH BUDDY

but they stop serving it at 5am. k go now!!

Wow I'm wondering if the other reviewers ate at the same place I did???
I stayed for 2 long weeks at the Tuscany and  the service at Marilyn's was average the food was a notch below Denny's.  I even told the manager calling ribs or chicken Bar B Que because you pour bbq sauce over them doesn't make them Bar B Que.   I've had five dinners here and one breakfast so I'm not rating this place on one visit. 
All my dinners were poor in every way. I had dessert one night and the cake tasted stale.   I sent it back an actually had to tell them to remove it from my bill as they were not going to. 
My breakfast meal was a very good omelette    Prices are good here but then again you truly get what you pay for

It's 2am in Vegas, hungry like there's no tomorrow. What? Steak and eggs? Sure! $5? That just makes it even more appetizing! 

Marilyn's cafe never ceases to satisfy! Located in the Tuscany Suites & Casino, it's just off the strip by a tad. Their graveyard special is just that - steak and eggs for $5. I haven't tried anything else, but this definitely makes a girl like me happy. You can order your choice of white or wheat bread, choice of cooked eggs (over easy is the way to go!), and it also comes with a side of hash. Yum. Steaks are the perfect portion size and cooked just right to your liking! Sure, it may not be the best steak and eggs, but for the price, it's excellent! 

Service is great and attentive! Friendly is a plus! Seating is always available which makes it even easier! 

Convenient and reasonably delicious! I'll be back for midnight munchies!
Really good, inexpensive breakfast. I had the 8.99 steak and eggs breakfast. The service was also very good. I would definitely recommend this place

Omg! So glad I found this place on yelp!! Delicious!!! Visited for breakfast on Sunday November 9, 2014. Best scrambled eggs with cheese!! Perfectly cooked, nice and moist. Pancakes were perfect, hash browns and sausage perfectly cooked! Server was a sweetheart too. Entire bill came out to 12 bucks!! Cheap and good!! Highly recommend!!! I'll be back!!

Our first time here. Never even heard of this Casino or the Hotel. Came here based in 4-star rating with over 300 reviews. 

We had to walk through the casino to find the restaurant. I was extremely impressed with the fact that there was hardly any trace of smoking in the air. Friendly staff, GREAT and freshly prepared food, and reasonably priced! Our waitress even offered us coffee to go workout even being asked.

We'll come back to this place, for sure!

$4 steak and eggs..  Oh whaaaat?!

Yawp.  This spot has cheap ass steak and eggs for pennies on what you would probably spend in Vegas.  It's inside Tuscany Casino which isn't such a great spot but it's well worth the trek for after club/drinking grub.  

Now onto the flavor of the meal.  It is $4 steak and eggs.  It's not some prime cut ish you would find in a bitchin steak house.  But for the price you pay, you definitely get something well worth it.  Now, I will say that my opinion on the flavor may be a little biased and skewed cuz of the drunked taste buds that think almost everything tastes good.  But whenever I go to Vegas, this is a spot we end up going to at least once during the trip.

Wow what a great experience and hidden gem!  So we came here on our way out of Vegas and went based off the Yelp reviews!  Of course since everyone was raving about the steak and eggs we had to try it and it was everything everyone said and more!  Great food great cooked perfectly coffee was very good, and our waitress Riza was soo amazing, super friendly and helpful,  the perfect waitress!!!!

Ate here for breakfast, it's a few blocks from the hotel I'm staying at. The place wasn't packed at all, then  again we did come at 7am. I believe it's open 24 hours tho. The service was good and the food wasn't spectacular, but it was good.

I give it a three-star because that says "A-OK."  My wife and I enjoyed breakfast here (once we found it in the rear of the Casino).  I had the Complete French Toast and she had the Meat Lover's Bowl.  Standard breakfast fare, nicely prepared and tasted like it was supposed to - eggs, sausage, bacon and French toast.  My wife's order came with a side of two (2) nice fluffy pancakes.  She said the breakfasts were "Yummy!"  There was enough food that we both ended up taking a sizable portion as carry out.  

I had a cup of coffee (I won't get that again - it didn't taste very good and they give you the creamer that comes in those little pull-tab plastic dealies).

Looks like they also take call-in orders as there is a "pick-up take-out" window.

Both meals including the coffee came to just under $22.00.  We would come back again.

3 steak and eggs and a fruit cup for $15? YES PLEASE. Late night cheap eats for after-clubbing food orgasms. Eggs (scrambled) were a bit tasteless and overcooked to me, and the steak could have been rarer/less dry, but hey...decent portion for a great price. Nothing more to say! Oh and plenty of sauces/dressings to douse the dryness out of the steak if need be!

Finally came on a Friday night to attack this $15 AYCE crab legs special I keep hearing about. I quickly changed my mind after see what everyone else was getting. Pretty basic crab legs that you could get at anywhere. So I decided to skip the AYCE crab legs and try something else.

Order a full rack of BBQ pork ribs. Amazing. Add them to my list of bbq spots. Tender fall off the bone, perfectly cooked, real delicious BBQ sauce. Also came with 2 sides and rolls at your demand, ask for corn bread you'll like them. I forget the price but it was about $13-15. Plenty of ribs to go around.

Steak and egg were ok a bet pricey about $13 regular and $6 during its graveyard special.

The monster burger special is still a good deal at $5 but I guess it wasn't as gourmet as I last thought but still good.

As always excellent service on a busy Friday night.

Two breakfast specials: All You Can Eat Pancakes for $3.99, or for $8.99, a 6 oz. NY Strip with 2 eggs, hash browns, pancakes or toast. I didn't think I had time today for the steak, so I opted for the pancakes. They were ready in short order and refills consisted of 2 additional pancakes at a time. The service was prompt and attentive. I think the music playing in the morning was post-disco, or the ratings would have been better; 5 stars instead of just 4 stars!
Horrid service!! Food was decent. The waitress was quadruple sat and forgot an order. Sigh.

Stopped by there for breakfast.  Basic breakfast food nothing special.

The service was pretty good.  

This would be a 3 star review because it was just good nothing really special at all.... the typical casino cafe.  The reason for a one star bump is because it was somewhat cheaper than other places for breakfast.

So - decent breakfast very reasonably priced with good service.

The reviews are true, great food, great service and great price.  Had the Veggie omelette and it was one of the better omelettes I have ever had.  

My service was always on the ready to fill my coffee cup and she was lightning fast.  

Parking is easy making this a much better spot for breakfast then anything on the strip!

this place is really stupid. first
of all the servers are rude and obviously hate their job???? idk but they have horrible attitudes. second they can't split checks at all? I work at a restaurant it is extremely easy to split a check or at least put a certain amount on different cards. the sever just did his side work the whole time which was rude and when we needed something he wasn't around we had to go up to him. so we had to use an ATM and get charged an extra 2.50 and then we get charged 18% gratuity like for what??? the service here was disgusting and it was annoying.
they need to get their shit together and I work at a restaurant so I do know how it goes and I think it was horrible it was a disgrace they need a new system and new staff because it was not good at all. I don't want to come back for those reasons

Really good food that's affordable & just a couple minutes away from the strip. We took the 202 bus there with no problems. The French toast is good , but I did not like the orange juice or the syrup that was served. It tasted old and the syrup was bland. Other than that , we enjoyed our food.

Convenient if you stay at the Tuscany Hotel, otherwise, you can find so much better. We had dinner there, then breakfast. Dinner : we ordered pizzas, and i'm pretty sure mine was bought at Walmart and defrosted. Breakfast : not very good, and I suspect it made me sick.

I wanted to order a make your own omelette breakfast. Agnes suggested I order the Supreme and substitute items that I wanted. It worked out better and was cheaper. It was delicious and way to filling. My wife ordered banana and yogurt with some french toast and that was also delicious. With a shot of Bailey's and a beer ,for breakfast , the bill was only about $30. I would suggest this place to anyone. Great food, great service, very reasonable prices.

Had a late night meal after the Jennifer Lopez concert. Our server James was the BEST! He was very professional, very personable & very attentive. The portions are HUGE & the prices are more than resonable. The restaurants at the Tuscany Garden Hotel and Suites does not believe in small portions. The food was very good. Thank you James for making us feel at home. I highly recommend Marilyns Cafe to everyone.

The food is actually really good, but they hardly ever get the order right when it's to go. On my most recent trip I ordered a hamburger no cheese. I know for a fact she understood this because she repeated it to me " hamburger, so you don't  want the cheese?".  I got a patty melt with lots of cheese, now i'm not lactose intolerant or allergic to cheese so i'll live, i'll be a big girl and eat it, but then I notice it's on the only bread that I know of that I do NOT like at all, Freakin Rye! but hey i'm already at home and maybe somehow someway they've taken all the ingredients I don't like on a burger and made this the best taste treat ever. Did it work you ask, did they accomplish the impossible?....... Do you see 5 stars?! Honestly if I was reviewing this meal alone i'd be giving it 1 star, I had to throw the burger away, but wait there's more I also ordered  a fried chicken salad ( to eat later) and I received no chicken on my salad, when she took it back to fix it she came back with grilled chicken. Oh I know it's healthier, but this is what I cook at home all the time I don't go out to eat what I make, and yes I let it go, I took it which was a good thing because as you previously read my burger sucked. I went out to eat and ended up with exactly what I already had at home. I do put up with it because the food is really good and the portions always leave you with left overs.

This place has good, no nonsense food.  The price is amazing.  In fact, the quality is on the upper end of food I've had in Vegas.  I will definitely be back if I'm even in Vegas again.

I had the turkey pot pie, and it was awesome.  I picked up the tab for my partner in crime, and it was lower by half what my next lowest dining bill was on this trip, just for me.
